We are looking for an Engineer - Water Management to join the Water Management team at Tom Price.
This role is for applicants residing in or willing to relocate to Tom Price, Pilbara, WA and is offered as a 5/2/4/3 roster.

ENGINEER - WATER MANAGEMENT
Be part of a group that is safety driven and values inclusion
Permanent employment which includes a huge range of additional benefits
Residential role based in Tom Price on 5/2/4/3 roster
About the role
All progress begins with pioneers. At Rio Tinto, it begins with you.
We are looking for an Engineer - Water Management to join the Water Management team at Tom Price.
This role is for applicants residing in or willing to relocate to Tom Price, Pilbara, WA and is offered as a 5/2/4/3 roster.
Reporting to the Superintendent Production Dewatering and Projects and working in a collaborative community of stakeholders, you will be:
Providing technical support to the Superintendent and the Dewatering Supervisor Team
Supporting the development of the water management schedule/ plan
Analysing and interpreting a broad array of water data
Coordinating and in regular communication with the Hydrology and Mine Technical Services teams
Providing daily and long-term water management advice to ensure the pit and site water balance requirements are adhered to
Providing technical guidance to the business on the capital acquisition process and completing associated paperwork
Establishing and maintaining positive relationships with both internal and external stakeholders
Facilitating the MTS alignment meeting and 6 weekly water steering committee meeting
Monitoring water management KPI’s
In addition to paying competitively and providing great benefits packages, we want you to live the lifestyle that is right for you and your family. And because of our size and scale, there are many opportunities to learn, grow and do more than you ever thought possible.
Every hour of every shift, your safety and wellbeing is our number one priority. We do the work only if it is safe, and we invest to make sure every member of the team has the quality tools they need to do their job.
What you will bring
A commitment to the safety of yourself and your team
Environmental Science or Engineering degree is desirable but not essential
Class C driving licence license
Experience in mine site water management
Experience in mine regulations and reporting is desirable
What we offer
A safety-focused and inclusive working environment
A competitive salary package with annual cash incentive awards (STIP)
Access to top tier family-friendly health and medical programs
A comprehensive leave policy that covers all moments that matter in life (vacation/annual, paid parental leave, short term sick leave, paid holidays)
Ongoing individual wellbeing support for you and your family for personal and professional matters
Generous Rio Tinto employee share program
About Rio Tinto
Every idea, every innovation, every little thing the world calls ‘progress’ begins with a first step, and someone willing to take it: explorers, inventors, entrepreneurs. Pioneers.
For nearly 150 years, Rio Tinto has been a company of pioneers – generations of people spanning the globe, all with the grit and vision to produce materials essential to human progress.
Our iron ore has shaped skylines from Shanghai to Sydney. Our aluminium – the world’s first to be certified “responsible” – helps planes fly and makes cars lighter. Our copper helps wind turbines power cities and our boron helps feed the world, and explore the universe.
Our diamonds help us celebrate the best parts of life.
Every Voice Matters
At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, women, the LGBTI+ community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds
Applications for this role will close on Thursday 1st September 2022.

At Lynas Rare Earths – we do interesting stuff!
Our Rare Earths deposit in Mt Weld, Western Australia, is acknowledged as one of the highest-grade Rare Earths mine in the world and we operate the world’s largest single Rare Earths processing plant in Malaysia – so you’re joining a very unique team! As a team member you will be contributing to the sustainable supply of rare earths metals which are used in oil & gas, electric vehicles and wind turbines.
Lynas is embarking on an expansion in Western Australia and we’re looking for a driven Graduate - Environmental wanting to join us on our journey.
Role:
Reporting to our Environmental Advisor, your primary responsibility will be to assist in the delivery of environmental monitoring and management programs at Mt Weld Rare Earth Project. The role will also assist the HSE team in other activities.
Core Skills and Competencies:
Effective communicator, both verbally and in written form, diplomatic with strong relationship building skills, proactive and shows initiative.
High attention to detail and accuracy - Data Entry, Reporting (internal and external), EMS development and review must be of a high level.
Ability to work productively with limited supervision.
Strong organisational skills.
Responsibilities:
Conduct environmental monitoring (e.g. flora, fauna, dust, groundwater, waste) data entry, and technical report preparation as per relevant licence/permit requirements granted under EP Act Part IV and V and Mining Act.
Support the maintenance and implementation of the ISO 14001 Certified Environmental Management System including draft preparation of management plans, procedures and maintaining compliance registers.
Participate in site inspections and audits, including external audits and assist in environmental incident investigations
Coordinate clearing activities under the site disturbance process and the management of disturbance data for external reporting
Assist to compile annual environmental reports, including but not limited to DWER and DMIRS AERs
Compile emissions data for NPI and NGER reporting
Management of environmental consultants and contractors
Assist in the delivery of environmental training and awareness to project personnel promoting continuous improvement in environmental management.
Assist with rehabilitation work across the operations including landform construction and reshaping, monitoring and technical investigations
Assist HSE team as required for Potable water and Hivol dust sampling.
Qualifications, Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Environmental Science, Resource or Conservation Science, Environmental Management or equivalent.
C class manual drivers’ licence, and comfortable with driving on gravel roads
Awareness of Western Australian environmental legislation
Expanding problem-solving skills, a proactive approach to your work, and high attention to detail
Desirable:
Knowledge of GIS Systems
Experience in undertaking field monitoring
Fauna handling skills will be beneficial, but not essential
Interested in becoming a member of the site Emergency Response Team
At Lynas Rare Earths, we pride ourselves on offering competitive remuneration packages and benefits. This role is FIFO from Perth on an 8/6 roster.
We are committed to ensuring that our workplace is inclusive, where all our people feel that they belong, are valued, and respected.
We welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, the LGBTIQA+ community, mature workers, as well as candidates with culturally diverse backgrounds.

Superintendent, Field Hydrogeology
Drive technical leadership and best practice in hydrogeology and hydrology data capture
Lead one of the largest and diverse field teams of their type
Influence and drive a culture of continuous improvement
Permanent opportunity which includes a huge range of additional benefits
FIFO 5:2, 4:3 roster
About the role
All progress begins with pioneers. At Rio Tinto, it begins with you.
We are an open, connected international team of technical specialists using some of the most exciting data and tools on the planet. We are the world leader in automation and smart mining. We have technical development programmes that are industry-leading and recognise the unique nature of your role. These provide opportunities to grow your career through a dedicated technical path while being rewarded for your unique skills.
We are looking for a Superintendent, Field Hydrogeology to join our Iron Ore business and lead an established team of 30+ hydrogeologists and hydro field technicians. Working together with our industry leading water-well drilling partners, your team is responsible for the acquisition of hydrogeology and hydrology data that underpins water-related technical guidance and mine water management across the entire life of our Tier 1 Pilbara assets, from development, implementation, operation, and closure.
Reporting to the Manager, Water Resource Evaluation, you will:
Manage the safe and efficient execution of Pilbara-wide water monitoring activities
Provide active safety and technical leadership of an existing Field Hydrogeology team, while playing a key part in the development of a newly formed Water Monitoring team
Develop and maintain data collection standards
Work closely with contract partners and CMS representatives to ensure regular constructive feedback and fair performance.
Advocate and drive adherence to scientific method in the design and execution of hydrogeological investigations.
Work collaboratively with both internal and external stakeholders to drive continuous improvement through adherence to PDCA (plan-do-check-act)
Establish effective working relationships with key operational stakeholders ensuring effective portfolio communications
Provide regular and routine input to the leadership at a department and divisional level
Recruit, coach and mentor a mid-size team of Field Hydrogeologists and Field Hydro Technicians in their roles to supervise the drilling, installation and testing of water supply, dewatering and groundwater monitoring infrastructure
What you’ll bring
A commitment to the safety of yourself and others, creating and maintaining a safe workplace
Demonstrated complex problem-solving abilitiesto deliver solutions across the business
Proven ability to build positive relationships
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
A good understanding of the application of different hydrogeological drilling methods in Pilbara terrain
A good understanding of best practice water-well construction, development and testing
A good appreciation of water management best practices across through planning, data acquisition, interpretation and reporting.
Provide context to your team that is meaningful to them and the work that we do
Create a positive environment focused on constructive feedback
A current manual WA Driver’s license
A minimum bachelor’s degree in geology, hydrogeology, relevant science or engineering field
It will be beneficial if you have:
Post-graduate training in water-related field
Be highly attuned to the challenges associated with water management in mining and the Pilbara
Understanding of WA regulatory environment applicable to water
What we offer
Be recognised for your contribution, your thinking and your hard work, and go home knowing you’ve helped the world progress.
A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
A permanent position working directly for Rio Tinto
A competitive base salary reflective of your skills and experience with annual incentive program
Comprehensive medical benefits including subsidised private health insurance for employees and immediate family
Attractive share ownership plan
Company provided insurance cover
Extensive salary sacrifice & salary packaging options
Career development & education assistance to further your technical or leadership ambitions
Ongoing access to family-friendly health and medical wellbeing support
Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation/annual, paid parental, sick leave)
Exclusive employee discounts (banking, accommodation, cars, retail and more)
Possible domestic relocation assistance
About Rio Tinto
Every idea, every innovation, every little thing the world calls ‘progress’ begins with a first step, and someone willing to take it: explorers, inventors, entrepreneurs. Pioneers.
Where you’ll be working
Working 5:2, 4:3 roster across multiple sites within the Pilbara.
In the Pilbara region of Western Australia, we own an integrated portfolio of iron ore assets: a world-class, integrated network of 16 mines, four independent port terminals, a 1,700 kilometre rail network and related infrastructure –all designed to respond rapidly to changes in demand. We are one of the world’s leading producers and exporters of iron ore.
Every Voice Matters
At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, women, the LGBTI+ community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.
We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome –they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.
Applications close on 17 August 2022 (Rio Tinto reserves the right to remove advertised roles prior to this date)

Date: 18-Jul-2022

Location:
Perth, WA, AU

Department: Audit and Assurance

Description:
Job Requisition ID: 22501

Be part of Australia’s largest cohort of graduates – meaning you’ll have a community of other grads to lean on and learn from.
Thrive in our team which operates nationally across Melbourne, Sydney and Perth, with a team culture that embraces learning through weekly knowledge sharing sessions, actively exploring the latest algorithms and ML techniques
Tech discounts – from Apple, HP, Lenovo, Windows… the list goes on!
Flexible work arrangements – work in a way that suits you best
Holistic well-being program – flu vaccinations and health & wellbeing focused work

You love data and the infinite insights that come from datasets. Joining our A&A Analytic Solutions Graduate Program, our top-tier data specialists will help you build on your existing data and analytical skills. Are you in?

What will you get to do?
In the A&A Analytic Solutions Graduate Program, you’ll get to build your skills on real client work as you attend client meetings, understand their problems and refine their requirements. Then, you’ll delve deep into client data to excavate business insights and develop creative solutions to clients. At Deloitte, you have our 100% support as we give you the latest tech to deliver to your potential. You’ll get to learn analytical tools like SQL, Python and R, visualisation tools such as Tableau and Power BI, and walk away with enviable programming skills. Are you sold?

Our team is at the forefront of new developments in the analytics space, making use of machine learning and artificial intelligence in the development of new tech assets through our Big Data Analytics Platform, InsightBoxTM, with which you will have the opportunity to work.

You can expect to be working on something new and exciting each day as you thrive across these roles within the team:

Through data and ML identify key risks for the largest Australian and Global Audit clients
Transform and analyse client data to understand if there is a risk of material misstatement, enhancing our audit offering to focus on where the risks are.
Put your Python and SQL skills to use through our Data Services offering, where client data is cleaned, transformed and organised for use through our cutting-edge “InsightBox” platform.
Create confidence and trust through Data Driven Assurance engagements
Turn organisational data into actionable insights and create client-tailored dashboards to guide our clients in improving their business processes and solving their most complex problems.
Explore a variety of spaces across marketing and remediation and making use of our in-house developed tools, such as transforming reporting through LedgerSight, and gaining visibility of small business payment performance through FairPayment
Disrupt the analytics profession through enhancing our Big Data Analytics Platform InsightBoxTM
Work with our talented team of developers on our exciting “InsightBox” platform, transforming and reimagining audit processes.
Get exposure to working in an agile framework and developing your programming skills in JavaScript, React, TypeScript, .NET, C# Python and Bash.

Your future starts with us.
Our A&A Analytic Solutions team uses a combination of data insights, modelling, digital technologies, machine learning and automation to transform and reimagine audit processes. We're absolute data nerds and love working with numbers and large data sets (the more unstructured, the better!).

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.
You’re an absolute data nut. You love working with numbers and large data sets (the more unstructured – the better!), and probably studied mathematics, engineering, technology, science, computer science or data analytics. You're also:

A natural problem-solver – You love puzzling your way through data problems
Analytical and methodical, but not afraid of fuzzy problems and ambiguity
A genuine team player who thrives on collaboration
A part-time coder (this is a bonus, not a must!)
Finishing your studies mid or end 2022 (or have recently graduated)

If you’re a big believer in the power of data, and love helping others understand and leverage their data – this is the team for you!

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.

We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

What's on offer
Competitive Salary
Work across leading edge technology in a highly experienced team
Experience within an innovative and creative business
Flexible home/office work arrangements
Salary Continuance insurance for all permanent employees
About the Position
We are looking for a Data Specialist to join the Data Centre team in Perth, to assist in processing and delivering data and digital products to our clients. The Data Centre works with Project Managers and Project Teams to create and maintain high quality datasets and deliverables.
As a data driven company, Fugro collects, collates, synthesize, and presents data in digital, interactive and charted formats. The Fugro Marine team acquires hydrographic, bathymetric, metocean, geophysical and geotechnical data using remotely operated vehicles (ROV), unmanned surface vessels (USV), dedicated survey vessels and vessels of opportunity.
Fugro Data Specialists are not made from a single mould. They encapsulate all types of professional abilities, including data science, data analytics, geomatics, surveying, cartography, engineering, multibeam processing and geophysics. Data Specialists have a passion for data, so an interest in computers, computer sciences, data and data processing will be a distinct advantage. Prior experience in the marine industry or surveying is not required.
Responsibilities include
Demonstration of Fugro’s core values;
Facilitate the delivery of data to a wide variety of teams
Contribution to the collation, synthesis and presentation of project and archived data
Actively keep up to date with latest developments in applicable software
Detailed responsibilities include
Generation of figures and charts
Use of industry and Fugro developed software
Application of GIS and CAD for the presentation of data
Processing of geospatial data, under guidance of others
Achieve the required timeframe for delivery
Adherence to quality protocols
The maintenance of digital databases and electronic files
Essential Qualifications
Recognised qualifications in Spatial Sciences, Computer Sciences, Surveying, Cartography, Geomatics, GIS, Applied Engineering or Engineering.
Desirable skills
Possess excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated problem-solving, decision-making and prioritising skills.
Ability to manage large volumes of information.
Proactively contribute to a teamwork environment.
Agency to develop professional skills.
Committed to delivering exceptional results.
About Fugro
Fugro are the world’s leading, independent provider of geo-data and asset integrity solutions for large constructions, infrastructure and natural resources. We provide the technical data and information required to design, construct and maintain engineering structures and infrastructure in a safe, reliable and efficient manner.
Our Values
https://www.fugro.com/about-fugro/group-overview/our-values
One Fugro
We strive to foster an inclusive environment where everyone feels comfortable to be themselves; all voices heard; all cultures respected. Our employees’ skillsets are diverse, and we treat each other with dignity and respect regardless of race, gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us an individual.
Fugro reserves the right to close this advert at any time.
Applications or interest via recruitment agencies will not be accepted at this time.
Disclaimer for recruitment agencies:
Fugro does not accept any unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies. Acquisition to Fugro Recruitment or any Fugro employee is not appreciated .

Superintendent, Water Quality and Mineral Waste Management
Drive technical leadership in water quality and mineral waste management
Help shape the strategic direction and vision for water management across RTIO
Influence and drive a culture of continuous improvement
Permanent opportunity which includes a huge range of additional benefits
Perth based with ad-hoc travel to site
About the role
All progress begins with pioneers. At Rio Tinto, it begins with you.
We are an open, connected international team of technical specialists using some of the most exciting data and tools on the planet. We are the world leader in automation and smart mining. We have technical development programmes that are industry-leading and recognise the unique nature of your role. These provide opportunities to grow your career through a dedicated technical path while being rewarded for your unique skills.
We are looking for a Superintendent, Water Quality and Mineral Waste Management to join our Iron Ore business and lead a team of hydrogeochemists and environmental geoscientists, responsible for providing subject matter expertise to our operations, studies, approvals, heritage, and closure functions. This is a great opportunity to positively lead and influence whilst working with a diverse stakeholder group geographically spread across our iron ore business to deliver a plan which considers the entire life of our Tier 1 assets, from development, implementation, operation, and closure.
Reporting to the Manager, Water Resource Evaluation, you will:
Review, update and maintain technical standards for water quality and mineral waste management
Actively identify and provide timely support to manage mineral waste and water quality risk
Provide expert technical guidance that is reliable, considered, transparent and defendable, clearly articulated and fit for purpose
Develop technical capability in mineral waste management and water quality
Support effective operation of site mineral waste management groups and studies
Deliver fit for purpose mineral waste management, water quality and pit lake assessments
Advocate and drive adherence to scientific method in the design and execution of hydrogeochemistry investigations
Work collaboratively with both internal and external stakeholders to drive continuous improvement through adherence to PDCA (plan-do-check-act)
Establish effective working relationships with key operational stakeholders ensuring effective portfolio communications
Provide regular and routine input to the leadership at a department and divisional level
What you’ll bring
A commitment to the safety of yourself and others, creating and maintaining a safe workplace
Demonstrated complex problem-solving abilitiesto deliver solutions across the business
Proven ability to build positive relationships
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
A good understanding of the application of different hydrogeological drilling methods in Pilbara terrain
A good understanding of best practice water-well construction, development and testing
A good appreciation of water management best practices across through planning, data acquisition, interpretation and reporting.
Provide context to your team that is meaningful to them and the work that we do
Create a positive environment focused on constructive feedback
A current manual WA Driver’s license
It will be beneficial if you have:
A minimum bachelor’s degree in geology, hydrogeology, relevant science or engineering field
Be highly attuned to the challenges associated with water management in mining and the Pilbara
What we offer
Be recognised for your contribution, your thinking and your hard work, and go home knowing you’ve helped the world progress.
A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
A permanent position working directly for Rio Tinto
A competitive base salary reflective of your skills and experience with annual incentive program
Comprehensive medical benefits including subsidised private health insurance for employees and immediate family
Attractive share ownership plan
Company provided insurance cover
Extensive salary sacrifice & salary packaging options
Career development & education assistance to further your technical or leadership ambitions
Ongoing access to family-friendly health and medical wellbeing support
Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation/annual, paid parental, sick leave)
Exclusive employee discounts (banking, accommodation, cars, retail and more)
Possible domestic relocation assistance

Working 5:2/4:3 roster across multiple sites within the Pilbara.

Working 5:2/4:3 roster across multiple sites within the Pilbara.
In the Pilbara region of Western Australia, we own an integrated portfolio of iron ore assets: a world-class, integrated network of 16 mines, four independent port terminals, a 1,700 kilometre rail network and related infrastructure –all designed to respond rapidly to changes in demand. We are one of the world’s leading producers and exporters of iron ore.
Every Voice Matters

Systems Biology and Genomics
Harry Perkins Institute of Medical Research
Full-time, fixed-term appointment for 24 months
Base salary range: Level A $74,236 – $99,905 p.a. plus 17% superannuation
The University of Western Australia (UWA) is ranked amongst the top 100 universities in the world and a member of the prestigious Australian Group of Eight research-intensive universities.? With an enviable research track record, vibrant campus and working environments, supported by the freedom to ‘innovate and inspire’ there is no better time to join Western Australia’s top university.
About the team
This position is based within the Systems Biology and Genomics Laboratory, led by Professor Alistair Forrest and is part of the UWA Centre for Medical Research within the Faculty of Health and Medical Sciences, based at Harry Perkins Institute of Medical Research (Perkins) in Nedlands. The Forrest lab is comprised of molecular, cellular and computational biologists, forming a multi-disciplinary team environment undertaking a diverse range of genomics and cancer single cell research. We are leading the Western Australian Cancer Single Cell initiative which is using single cell, single nuclei and spatial transcriptomic profiling to characterize hundreds of tumour samples kindly donated by patients around Perth.
About the opportunity
You will perform analyses of single cell, single nuclei and spatial transcriptomic datasets generated by the lab on cancer samples kindly donated by patients across Perth. You will run established pipeline workflows on next generation sequencing datasets, interpret the results and write manuscripts. You may also help establish new workflows incorporating the newest tools for analysis of single cell/nuclei and spatial transcriptomic datasets.
To be considered for this role, you will demonstrate:
A PhD or equivalent in molecular biology, bioinformatics, computer science, data science, mathematics, biostatistics or a related field with an emphasis in the specific fields of bioinformatics, genomics and systems biology
Demonstrated ability to analyse next generation sequencing data, form hypotheses, test them and follow through to publications
Proficiency in R and Python (preferred) or other programming languages, with demonstrated experience in writing, reusing, and documenting the code
Proficiency with the command line and working on remote Linux servers
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision as well as to work together as part of a team
Well-developed written and verbal communication skills, organisational skills and the ability to meet deadlines
About your application
Full details of the position's responsibilities and the selection criteria are outlined in the position description: POSITION DESCRIPTION [Research Associate] - Position Number [320565] - Level [A].pdf
The content of your Resume and Cover Letter should demonstrate how you meet the selection criteria.
COVID-19
In line with the Western Australia COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination Programme the successful applicant for this position will be required to provide proof of their full COVID-19 vaccination status (or have a Vaccination Exemption Statement) before commencing work at UWA.
Closing date: 11:55PM on Wednesday, 24 August 2022
To learn more about this opportunity, please contact Amy Marks on amy.marks@uwa.edu.au.
This position is open to international applicants.

About BHP

At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success.

Come and be a part of this success.

About the Role

Provides technical expertise in the execution of workforce listening and advanced analytics programs.

Partners across HR to develop and execute the strategic / advanced analytics program, focusing on the application of predictive / prescriptive analytics to solve BHP’s strategic people challenges.
Runs and enhances BHP’s workforce listening strategy, including the Engagement and Perception Survey and other Qualtrics programs.
Provides advanced workforce Analysis and insights to BHP leaders, including support for ELT and Board presentations.
Develops and undertakes strategic workforce modelling and insights program in partnership with Strategic Workforce Planning teams.
Develops and maintains the underpinning data and data infrastructure to support advanced people analytics.
About You

Advanced statistical analysis
Working with Microsoft PowerBI / Spotfire programs.
Coding with Python or R
Survey & Research Design
Advanced Data Science training

About Our Process

At BHP, we are committed to employing individuals who align with the BHP Charter Values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks.

To ensure the safety and wellbeing of our people, BHP requires employees in Australia to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 in line with BHP’s Covid Policy and any relevant State health directives. If you are applying for a role at BHP please consider this requirement when submitting your application. BHP will also adhere to any relevant health directives that may be made that affects our workforce.

Supporting a Diverse Workforce
The size and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance-based bonuses and a unique BHP employee share program.

At BHP, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and we encourage applications from women and Indigenous people. We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.

About RIG Technologies:
Welcome to RIG Technologies International. RIG Tech is a young, dynamic, cutting edge R&D company developing world leading instrumentation for the drilling industry.
We rapidly design, prototype, test and manufacture products utilising new and exciting technologies to achieve our vision of improving the efficiency of the mining process by delivering better data faster.
The team is based in our Technology Centre in Perth, and have equipment utilised around the world with a range of drilling contractors and OEMs. Our major customers are blue chip companies in the mining industry.
Rig Technologies is in a period of unprecedented growth and has recently become part of the Orica family of companies.
The Job:
We are looking for a Chief Information Officer to join our diverse team of engineers, scientists, and programmers.
Your duties will include;
Leading the IT operations and development of internal software applications
Developing the IT strategy and policies
Directing the executive team on best practice and processes
Develop goals and strategies to ensure the IT Department runs smoothly and effectively
Direct and establish IT-related projects
Monitor changes in the technology sector to discover ways the company can improve and develop
Supervise the networks and computer systems in the company to ensure optimal performance
Plan and direct the implementation of new IT systems
Provide leadership to IT specialists and other staff within the company
Create and adapt technological platforms to improve the client experience
Troubleshoot data-related issues and establish regular maintenance
The Candidate:
This position is ideal for highly technical individuals with excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
They will also possess the following essential skills, experience and attributes;
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other relevant field
Minimum of 15 years’ experience in Information Technology and Data Management
Proficiency in establishing IT services framework and IT security policies
A highly analytical mindset with superb problem-solving skills
Good understanding of modern databases and information system technologies
In-depth knowledge of the current and up-and-coming trends in the IT field
In-depth knowledge of data administration and management processes
Excellent organisational skills
Creativity: Ability to create things that are new
The Benefits:
RIG Tech offers competitive remuneration and a chance to work in an exciting, fast-paced multi-disciplinary team environment with a healthy work/life balance. In support of this we offer a range of benefits including;
A rewarding career path and unique exposure to a wealth of opportunities within the company
Flexible working arrangements
Ongoing training and professional development to support your growth and career progression
Support for those with young families, and parents returning to the workforce
Employee Assistance Program
How to apply:
RIG Technologies values diversity and encourages applications from people of all backgrounds to join our dynamic and inclusive work environment. If you are confident you have the essential qualifications, skills and experience, please submit a current Resume/CV.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $44,391.92 – $151,200.96 per year
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Ability to commute/relocate:
Welshpool, WA 6106: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)
Experience:
IT management: 10 years (Required)

Australia (Required)

International Centre for Radio Astronomy Research (ICRAR)
Lead research projects and learn new skills in a dynamic and supportive team environment
2-year fixed-term full time opportunity- flexible working arrangements are supported such as part time work or school hours
Base salary range: Level C $128,152 – $147,413 p.a. (pro rata) plus 17% superannuation
The University of Western Australia (UWA) is ranked amongst the top 100 universities in the world and a member of the prestigious Australian Group of Eight research-intensive universities. With an enviable research track record, vibrant campus and working environments, supported by the freedom to ‘innovate and inspire’ there is no better time to join Western Australia’s top university.
About the team
ICRAR is a WA State funded high profile equal joint venture established in 2009 between Curtin University and The University of Western Australia (UWA). The Centre’s headquarters are located at UWA, with research nodes at both UWA and Curtin. ICRAR is one of the largest astronomy institutions and one of the lead Australian organisations participating in the international Square Kilometre Array (SKA) Project. ICRAR has been further funded from 2019 to 2024 with $25 Million by the WA State Government and equal contribution from the Joint Venture Universities. The Data Intensive Astronomy (DIA) program of ICRAR has secured a contract to participate in the software development of the SKA for the whole construction period until 2028.
About the opportunity
As a Senior Research Fellow you will use your skills and experience in advanced data science technologies to contribute to the DIA program of the ICRAR.
You will lead and initiate cutting edge data science research projects that draw on your data science expertise. You will also be uniquely placed to contribute to a range of other projects within SKA, both directly supporting and working with ICRAR scientists, but also working with cross-disciplinary teams within UWA and with industry. This is an exciting opportunity to develop new projects, expand your research repertoire and learn new skills.
To be considered for this role, you will demonstrate:
PhD in a scientific field, computer science or software engineering.
Demonstrated ability in the creation of custom-built vision and/or time-sequence models and assess and present their quality using frameworks and toolkits like pytorch, tensorflow, mxnet, scipy and matplotlib or similar
Experience or expertise in statistical data analysis and programming
Ability to identify and publish new and interesting research opportunities and publish them
Excellent team player with the ability to collaborate with diverse groups
About you
We can offer flexible working arrangements to fit in with your family’s requirements or personal wellbeing. However since the SKA and our other activities are global, we do have to attend occasional on-line meetings after hours. There will also be occasional domestic or international travel required.
About your application
Full details of the position's responsibilities and the selection criteria are outlined in the position description: PD 510191.pdf
You are required to address the selection criteria in your submission in a separate document. For information to assist you with compiling statements to answer the selection criteria, please visit Addressing the selection criteria.
Closing date: 11:55 PM AWST on Monday, 22 August 2022
To learn more about this opportunity, please contact Prof. Andreas Wicenec by e-mail to andreas.wicenec@uwa.edu.au.
This position is open to international applicants.

Superintendent, Hydrogeology
Drive technical leadership in hydrogeology and mine water management
Help shape the strategic direction and vision for water management across RTIO
Influence and drive a culture of continuous improvement
Permanent opportunity which includes a huge range of additional benefits
Perth based with ad-hoc travel to site

About the role

All progress begins with pioneers. At Rio Tinto, it begins with you.

We are an open, connected international team of technical specialists using some of the most exciting data and tools on the planet. We are the world leader in automation and smart mining. We have technical development programmes that are industry-leading and recognise the unique nature of your role. These provide opportunities to grow your career through a dedicated technical path while being rewarded for your unique skills.

We are looking for a Superintendent, Hydrogeology to join our Iron Ore business and lead a team of hydrogeologists and groundwater modelers, responsible for providing subject matter expertise to our operations, studies, approvals, and heritage functions across one of three geographical hubs. This is a great opportunity to positively lead and influence whilst working with a diverse stakeholder group geographically spread across our iron ore business to deliver a plan which considers the entire life of our Tier 1 assets, from development, implementation, operation, and closure.
Reporting to the Manager, Water Resource Evaluation, you will:
Support and develop technical capability in hydrogeology and groundwater modelling
Actively identify and provide timely support to water-related risk
Advocate and drive adherence to scientific method in the design and execution of hydrogeological investigations.
Provide expert technical guidance that is reliable, considered, transparent and defendable, clearly articulated and fit for purpose
Work collaboratively with both internal and external stakeholders to drive continuous improvement through adherence to PDCA (plan-do-check-act)
Establish effective working relationships with water management stakeholders ensuring effective portfolio communications
Provide regular and routine input to the leadership at a department and divisional level

What you’ll bring
A commitment to the safety of yourself and others, creating and maintaining a safe workplace
Demonstrated complex problem-solving abilities to deliver solutions across the business
Proven ability to build positive relationships
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills – ability to build networks with a wide range of people, ability to influence and build consensus.
A solid understanding of water management best practices through planning, data acquisition, interpretation and reporting.
Flexibility to travel to our operational mine sites on a regular basis
Provide context to your team that is meaningful to them and the work that we do
Create a positive environment focused on constructive feedback
A current manual WA Driver’s license

It will be beneficial if you have:
A minimum bachelor’s degree in geology, hydrogeology, relevant science or engineering field
Be highly attuned to the challenges associated with water management in mining and the Pilbara

What we offer

Be recognised for your contribution, your thinking and your hard work, and go home knowing you’ve helped the world progress.
A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
A permanent position working directly for Rio Tinto
A competitive base salary reflective of your skills and experience with annual incentive program
Comprehensive medical benefits including subsidised private health insurance for employees and immediate family
Attractive share ownership plan
Company provided insurance cover
Extensive salary sacrifice & salary packaging options
Career development & education assistance to further your technical or leadership ambitions
Ongoing access to family-friendly health and medical wellbeing support
Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation/annual, paid parental, sick leave)
Exclusive employee discounts (banking, accommodation, cars, retail and more)
Possible domestic relocation assistance

About Rio Tinto

Every idea, every innovation, every little thing the world calls ‘progress’ begins with a first step, and someone willing to take it: explorers, inventors, entrepreneurs. Pioneers.

For nearly 150 years, Rio Tinto has been a company of pioneers –generations of people spanning the globe, all with the grit and vision to produce materials essential to human progress. Our iron ore has shaped skylines from Shanghai to Sydney. Our aluminium –the world’s first to be certified “responsible” –helps planes fly and makes cars lighter. Our copper helps wind turbines power cities and our boron helps feed the world and explore the universe. Our diamonds help us celebrate the best parts of life.

Where you’ll be working

Working Monday to Friday, you will be based at the Central Park building, location in Perth CBD.

In the Pilbara region of Western Australia, we own an integrated portfolio of iron ore assets: a world-class, integrated network of 16 mines, four independent port terminals, a 1,700 kilometre rail network and related infrastructure –all designed to respond rapidly to changes in demand. We are one of the world’s leading producers and exporters of iron ore.

Every Voice Matters

At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, women, the LGBTI+ community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.

We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome –they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.

Applications close on 10 August 2022 (Rio Tinto reserves the right to remove advertised roles prior to this date)

Here at Accenture, we are looking for Cloudheads. People who live and breathe Cloud. Inventive, imaginative and optimistic people whose heads are filled with the possibilities that Cloud technology can unleash.
If you are looking to be in a role where you will be involved in discovering deeper insights, making predictions or generating recommendations and drive data to insights that enable businesses to make key decisions apply NOW!
About the role
You will be working on client projects with our growing team from across our Modern Data Platform and Applied Intelligence practice alongside our industry, functional and technology SMEs on some of our clients most challenging projects.
Joining our team in the Experience Engineering capability, you bee be involved in the following areas:
Digital Data Engineering
Drive the design and implementation of models and systems to harness the power of data and analytics that can be used to drive decision making
Develop large scale business intelligence/data strategy for clients to achieve long range goals
May lead a team that uses quantitative methods to derive actionable insights and outcomes from data
Integrate large and complex systems and data effectively and efficiently

Use quantitative methods to derive actionable insights and outcomes from data

Designing the Data Model required for supporting the reporting requirements.

Design and develop complex reporting solutions including reports, documents and dashboards.
Incorporate standards and best practices in the metadata and report/dashboard development.
Involve with the implementation planning, support, performance testing, and troubleshooting.
Implement deployment approaches and methods to roll out system change.
Have a degree of accountability for assigned tasks, our clients and/or the organization, as indicated by size of work effort and scale of entity and/or program
Managing small teams and/or work efforts at a client or within Accenture
About you
You will
gather, engineer and prepare data for consumers to enable smarter decision making. Use a broad set of data curation and analytical tools and techniques to enable development of quantitative and qualitative business insights.
work with partners as necessary, integrate systems and data quickly and effectively, regardless of technical challenges or business environments.
deliver digestible, contemporary and immediate data content to support and drive business decisions
be involved in all aspects of BI Solutions from delivery planning, estimating and analysis, all the way through to delivery and production implementation.

Preferred
3 to 5 years of BI Application implementation experience in leading data analytics and visualization products such as Tableau, Qliksense, PowerBI, MicroStrategy, SAS Visual Analytics, and/or other Business Intelligence platforms.

About Accenture
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 710,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.
At Accenture, our philosophy is anchored in recognising that our people are multi-dimensional. We take an intersectional human approach to create a work environment where all people feel like they can bring their authentic selves to work, every day.
We believe that equality drives innovation. Our commitment to accelerating equality starts at the top with our board and CEO and extends across every part of the company. This comes to life when our people own the equality agenda, making it part of their jobs – every decision, every day – and feel free to speak up and to act.
We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences, such as age, ability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion, or sexual orientation. We want a workplace that is inclusive and diverse to that end we are setting bold goals and taking comprehensive action. To achieve these goals, we collect information that allows us to track the effectiveness of our Inclusion and Diversity programs.
Learn how Accenture protects your personal data and know your rights in relation to your personal data. Read more about our Privacy Statement.

Date: 04-Aug-2022

Location:
Perth, WA, AU

Department: Risk Advisory

Description:
Job Requisition ID: 21781

Be part of Australia’s largest cohort of Vacationers – meaning you’ll have a community of other students to lean on and learn from!
Build your skills on real client work and purpose led projects at some of Australia’s most significant organisations
Join an organisation recognised for its commitment to diversity and wellbeing in the workplace, and where making an impact that matters is our goal.

You’re an absolute data nut. You love working with numbers and large data sets (the more unstructured – the better!). We help clients navigate risks and capture opportunities with insights from their data. If you have an aptitude for problem solving and inquisitive thinking, a graduate role in our Data & Analytics team could be for you.

What will you get to do?
No two days are the same in the Data & Analytics team. On a typical project, you’ll start off by sourcing and preparing data for analysis. Then, you’ll dive deep into the data to develop meaningful insights for the client using software like Excel, SQL and advanced statistical modelling software such as Python, SAS, SPSS and R. Don’t fret, you'll have 100% support from the team as you pick up these new skills! Once you’ve discovered hidden data insights, you’ll get to develop tailored recommendations and solutions for the client. Pretty cool, right?

Your future starts with us.
Our curious and data-driven team is comprised of 3 main pillars:

Data Risk and Compliance Analytics: Our Data Risk and Compliance Analytics team supports our clients from development of their data strategy and governance framework through to implementation of operational analytics solutions leveraging robotic process automation and machine learning. Currently, we’re focusing on regulatory compliance, reducing operational risk, data lifecycle management, and controls transformation within a wide range of industries!
Workplace Integrity: Our Workplace Integrity team combines practitioners with advanced analytic skills and deep industrial relations expertise to support clients to navigate the complex workplace regulatory landscape and identify innovative opportunities to achieve great outcomes for businesses and their employees.
Advisory: Shape strategy, define policy and navigate the changing regulatory environment for our clients

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.
You are an inquisitive student with a knack for solving complex problems. You may also have:

Data Risk: Background in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Studies, Commerce, IT, Computer Science or equivalent fields
Advisory & Workplace Integrity: Background in Business, Commerce, Finance or similar
Great interpersonal skills and thrive in collaborative environments
A passion for data analysis and presenting data for visual impact
A drive to untangle challenges and solve ambiguous and fuzzy problems with creative solutions
Motivated to use your own initiative to achieve high standards for your clients and team.

Why Deloitte?
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.
We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.
We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.

Insights Analyst - Marketing
VGW is a fast-growing technology company and creator of market-leading online social games. With offices across Australia, USA, Canada, Malta and the Philippines we are on a mission to be the biggest gaming company in the world!
We currently have an opportunity for an Insights Analyst to join our Marketing team in Perth.
As the Insights Analyst you will help enable Marketing with timely, accurate, and valuable insights to enhance Marketing's understanding of our audience and use data from disparate sources to shine light on marketing performance. By understanding our business you will create new and better ways to understand marketing scale and efficiency.
Key responsibilities will include:
Analyse and monitor many different aspects of marketing campaign performance.
Use analytical expertise to solve specific business problems and highlight risks and opportunities while being able to improve and suggest new and better ways to analyse VGW marketing performance.
Work with stakeholders to identify and deliver strategically valuable insights that directly influence key metric improvement.
Work closely with product owners to understand and enhance customer data sources to improve overall customer experiences.
Collaborate with other members of the Data & Analytics team (Data Engineers, Data Scientists and Insight Analysts) as well the broader Marketing team, BU General Managers and Product Owners.
Collaborating with Non-Product teams such as Data Engineering for ingestion and transformation of data used in analytics/reporting, and Data Science for development and application of predictive modelling/machine learning.
What you will bring to the role:
Proven track record as a Marketing Analyst or other analytics roles, preferably within gaming, mobile, technology or digital industries.
BA/MSc in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics, or other quantitative field; Masters desirable.
Ability to identify winning opportunities and determine complex resolutions cross functionally where needed (e.g. Engineers, Product Managers, Analysts, Business and Marketing functions at all levels).
Expert SQL coding and data visualisation skills in Tableau and or PowerBI.
Experience working with large and complex datasets.
About VGW
VGW has been disrupting the online gaming world since 2010 and we're only getting started. We've assembled an incredibly talented global team who bring their passion, energy and expertise to build games that people love.
At VGW, we have a modern approach to getting work done and a focus on creating an environment where amazing people can do amazing work. That means giving you the flexibility you need, providing spaces that will keep you comfortable and finding opportunities for you to keep learning and growing.
Find out more at www.vgw.co
If you want to join a team that does things differently apply today and we look forward to seeing what you can bring to our team.

ABOUT THE COMPANY

ConeTec is an international full-service geo-environmental and geotechnical site characterization contractor. We offer clients superior project management and site investigation services across the globe, with a large presence in the Americas and Australia. ConeTec is known in the industry as a great place to work. We commit to all employees that we will provide a respectful, positive, and enriching work environment. We want you to look forward to going to work every day. We reward and recognize staff for exceptional contributions to the company. Our success is a direct result of the people who work here.

SCOPE OF POSITION

The Field Engineer will assume numerous other roles ranging from Field Engineer, Assistant Field Operator to Project Coordinator as the ever-changing demands of the workplace dictate. A successful candidate must have well-developed interpersonal, organizational and communication skills as well as strong problem-solving abilities. The position will involve significant amounts of travel for periods 4 weeks throughout Western Australia. As part of a small growing team of employees, you will be relied on for your flexibility and versatility.

OVERALL GOALS FOR POSITION
Gain experience and exposure as a contractor in the mining, construction and infrastructure industries
Expand skill set through training and certifications to become an asset to a larger team.
Complete complex site investigation programs throughout the Oceania and International regions that we operate in.
Assist in developing new business by providing a wide-ranging skillset.

ROLES, RESPONSIBILITIES & EXPECTATIONS

Equipment Operation
Familiarize with and operate SCPTu equipment, VST, sampling systems, numerous geophysical instruments and other in-situ testing equipment safely
and productively.
Become trained, company-certified and competent to operate numerous types of drilling equipment and other pieces of equipment within our extensive
fleet.
Organize logistics for the mobilization and demobilization of equipment in hard-to-access environments.
Perform routine maintenance on various pieces of equipment to ensure optimal performance.

Data Collection & Reporting
Perform testing to collect data in a timely, orderly and accurate manner.
Compile the collected data, sample logs, etc. daily and submit to the Engineer/Supervisor and/or client for further processing.
Collect field notes and photos to guarantee the translation of data from the field to the office is as highly accurate as possible.
Prepare and compile final field reports.

Health & Safety
Identify with and respect ConeTec’s safety culture, first and foremost.
Ensure proper preparation and knowledge of all necessary safe operating procedures before beginning any job.
Report any safety-related incidents, infractions, or near misses to the Project Manager and the HSE Officer, immediately.
Know and follow the incident reporting protocol at all times.


Other General Responsibilities
Communicate with the Supervisor or Project Manager as to any equipment problems or needs, as well as any field observations that might be of use.
Perform other shop functions as required.


SKILLS, QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

Education Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Applied Science, Geology, Geophysics or Related Fields
Must be eligible for registration with Engineers Australia.
Knowledgeable in a wide range of ConeTec's testing types and mechanically inclined.
Driver’s license and clean driving record.

Experience Requirements

Previous field experience would be an asset but not required.
Be able to work in a variety of remote locations.


Technical Skill Requirements
Must be able to perform physically demanding tasks, including lifting, moving heavy materials up to 50 lbs., climbing, crawling as well as walking on uneven ground, working long hours in all weather conditions
Electrical and mechanical technical skills are an asset.
Having data processing and report preparation skills is an asset


Soft Skill Requirements
Must possess a strong work ethic and professionally represent the company.
Must be able to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
Must be responsible and work well independently or in a team setting with minimal supervision.
Must enjoy working outdoors and travelling for extended periods.
Must enjoy performing a wide variety of duties and be able to manage multiple tasks and priorities.
Strong decision-maker with the ability to work independently in remote locations.


Other Requirements
Must be able to present proof of Covid-19 vaccination. Partial, full or medical exemption proof required.
Must be flexible and capable of taking on a variety of roles as required by business needs.

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, and due to the requirement that employees be able to safely complete the tasks associated with this job position, a successful candidate may be required to take a pre-employment fit for duty test, including a drug and alcohol testing, and complete a satisfactory criminal record check.

ConeTec is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, or any other status protected by applicable law.

Location: Karratha
Type: Permanent
Post Date: Mon Jul 25 10:03:04 2022
Ref: 060320
Karridale Group Pty Ltd is a leading services provider to the Australian Resources Industry specialising in major mine site fixed plant maintenance, structural, mechanical, and piping installations.
Here at Karridale Group, we are focused on growing our position in the Australian Resource sector. With this growth comes new roles and those rare opportunities to get noticed and grow with the business for years to come.
***Site Administrator - Entry Level***
Location: Sino Iron
Term: Full-time
Roster: 8:6 (Days only)
About the role:
Have you recently graduated from university and are looking to get your foot in the door in Mining???
If so, this position is for you - We will provide you with all the required training to get you up to speed.
Reporting to Site Manager this role is responsible for providing administrative support to ensure the smooth running of site operations.
Your responsibilities will be to:
Manage site crew roster, travel and accommodation bookings including visitor site access.
Liaise with site management and individual workers to rectify any roster, leave or termination discrepancies.
Process and record daily sign on/sign off timesheets and approved leave forms.
Update and maintain training records for site based personnel.
Order and maintain crib supplies, office stationary and consumables to maintain an appropriate amount of stock on site.
Create and maintain personal files on site ensuring the high level of confidentiality in accordance with the company procedures.
Establish and maintain efficient filing and archiving system in accordance with the company procedures.
Assist with the data entry for payroll and HSET requirements and compiling weekly and monthly KPI reports.
Other admin duties as directed by Site Manager.
Necessary skills and Qualifications:
Diploma or Bachelor’s Degree in engineering, science, mathematics, economy, accounting or finance - Highly desirable
University Graduates preferred
C Class Driver’s License.
Sound knowledge of MS Office products such as Excel, Word, Power point, and Outlook.
Willingness to Learn
Good attention to detail and ability to work under pressure
WA based candidates only will be considered for the role.
Ready for your next challenge? Make a fresh start with Karridale Group.
If you believe that you have the necessary attitude and skills for this role, apply now! Shortlisting will commence immediately.
Please note: Agency submissions will not be considered for this position.

Are you a Facebook nerd? Do you spend your days in FBM and GA?
About Lily and Fox
Lily and Fox is an Australian cosmetics company that is experiencing tremendous growth and we need your help!
We are simplifying beauty for the world. Making it possible for everyone to have beautiful nails. We are redefining how nails are done for 7 billion people, by making it possible to change your nails as quickly and easily as you change your clothes.
Founded in 2018, we've grown to a multi-million dollar operation bringing thousands of smiles to people's faces every day. We've grown a lot, but we are still tiny relative to the opportunity. We have a lot of work ahead and a big vision that we need the help of smart and ambitious people to accomplish.
We want people to be able to use their nails as a full expression of their true selves, to show the world who they really are.
As we are a small business, you will be exposed to many more parts of the business than you would at a larger business (this is a great opportunity for the right person!).
You must be comfortable learning new skills.
The Role
Customer focused: Our customers are changing the way nails are done, and it is your job to exceed their expectations of what a cosmetics experience should be. You will be interested in building the next revolution in cosmetics for 7 billion people. We expect you to go above and beyond for our customers.
Your main focus will be advertising in the digital market with an emphasis on Facebook and Instagram. We are ready to scale our business to reach everyone on the planet and need your help telling the stories that will transform the beauty industry.
The ideal candidate will demonstrate exemplary attention to detail, time management, critical thinking, innovation, and multi-tasking abilities. They must demonstrate proven success in a dynamic and fast paced environment with exceptional communication skills
The mission is to create an environment for our high-performing teams that allows them to realize their true potential. Whichever group we collaborate with, we constantly push ourselves to approach challenges from first principles. Our team aligns around three pillars – Design, Build and Operate. Together we focus on optimizing the space we have, finding the best solutions to our expansion needs, and devising and driving our long-term strategy. All of this under the guiding principle of simplifying beauty.
As a part of the Marketing Team you act in the best interest of Lily and Fox at all times. You must have a passion for our mission, our people, and our customers.
Attitude and approach is everything. You must:
Be a leader and a team player
Love to change the status quo and work well in high-pressure situations. Exceptional prioritization and time management skills are essential for success.
Be proactive. You must think and plan ahead to give your team the tools they need to be successful.
Be self-aware, flexible, and open-minded.
Possess a rare combination of analytical thinking, hands-on problem solving, and a customer-service mindset.
Be an advocate for our customers and your team. Your success depends on theirs.
Who we are looking for:
A savvy and proactive person to help us scale up our Marketing efforts through broad campaign creation and experimentation.
When you apply, please include the words “marketing is cool” as the first line of your application. Any applicants that do not include this phrase will not be considered.
The media coordinator/digital media specialist is tasked with securing advertising in the digital space with an emphasis on Facebook and Instagram. Media could include paid search, paid social, display (Google Ads and others), SEO, etc.
The media coordinator will be willing to learn and conduct research to help identify the right digital media mix for specific campaigns. The needs will differ based on the needs of the project, so it is important to approach each problem individually and maintain strong communication in order to work well with co-workers, and outside parties.
It is also important to be able to multitask, as multiple campaigns are usually assigned at once. Attention to detail is key, as all digital campaigns will need constant monitoring and optimization. Furthermore, the ideal team member will have the following:
Main Responsibilities:
You will be responsible for Multimedia content creation. This includes:
Running digital advertising campaigns in Google Ads and other platforms before, during and after campaigns, including implementation, optimization and some reporting.
Work with the team to develop and execute bidding strategies, including but not limited to keywords, objectives, demographics, remarketing, retargeting, custom audience lists, etc.
Help to analyze and optimize campaigns throughout their duration in order to maximize results for campaign KPIs. Assist in A/B testing to improve performance.
In conjunction with the digital strategy team, assist with SEO for our global websites.
Stay up-to-date on industry trends, shifts and best practices, building your skillset into the digital media buying subject matter expert. Obtain relevant certifications (e.g. Google Search Certification).
Basic Qualifications:
Motivated learner
You have effective time management and organization skills, strong communication and interpersonal skills, a positive attitude and a growth mindset
Use web analytics tools to monitor digital campaigns.
Inform strategy and channel teams of research results through written reports.
Demonstrates ability to analyze data, using the data to drive decision making.
Ability to maintain composure in critical situations and communicate clearly with both internal and external stakeholders.
Be a self-starter with good organizational and communication skills
Easily approachable, cooperative, and a team player, easily gains the trust and support of Associates and peers.
Ability to embrace constant change with flexibility and good grace.
Skilled use of office software. Proficient in MS Excel and other MS Office equivalents.
Critical thinking, problem solving, and determination
Prepare schedules, adjusting as needed.
Experiment and keep up to date with new platforms and channels.
Monitor costs, goals and return on investment (ROI)
Demonstrate a commitment to our company's core values
Preferred:
Intermediate Excel skills
Highly organized and detail oriented.
Google Search, Google Display and Video Certifications are a plus.
Awareness of Google Analytics
Tertiary degree in marketing, data science, communications or related discipline.
Experience in digital functions including digital strategy, paid search, digital advertising, SEO strategy development.
Prior experience in a service-focused industry: E-commerce expertise is not required.
Ability to motivate and develop individuals and teams
What Lily & Fox Offers:
Attractive salary
Coaching and training
Flexibility
A supportive and inclusive environment
Being a part of a fast growing international business!
This is not a work from home position.
Good luck to everyone who applies!
