Reference ID: 41623

Data and Reporting Specialist
Be part of a group that is safety driven and values inclusion and diversity
Work in a cutting-edge technology hub in a diverse and dynamic team
Monday-Friday based at the Perth offices with flexible working from home arrangements.
About the role
All progress begins with pioneers. At Rio Tinto, it begins with you.
We are looking for a Data and Reporting Specialist to make a positive impact to the business by leading a team specialised in data architecture and data and reporting solutions, that drive critical business planning and improvement processes, with better service and support outcomes for Rio Tinto’s Iron Ore business in Western Australia.
Work in a diverse team of talented analysts / developers / leaders, working on a broad range of initiatives with various asset groups, platforms, and stakeholders.
This role is a great opportunity for collaborating closely with stakeholders and the operations across the RTIO business to facilitate effective data and reporting solutions.
We are an open, connected international team of specialists using some of the most exciting data and tools on the planet. We are the world leader in automation and smart mining. We have development programmes that are industry-leading and recognise the unique nature of your role. These provide opportunities to grow your career through a dedicated technical path while being rewarded for your unique skills.
Reporting to the Superintendent Data Reporting Solutions and working in a challenging and exciting environment, you will be:
Leading a team of data and reporting engineers to deliver reporting solutions effectively, to Business Intelligence and automation principles.
Leading the exploration and implementation of leading practices in technology, particularly the DevOps and cloud frameworks, to deliver data and reporting solutions with the best business outcomes.
Defining the technical scopes for sustainable end to end delivery of simple to complex data solutions.
Take ownership of the implementation of Scrum within the team, acting as the product owner and ensuring the team has the required support to be successful in Scrum.
Governing and refining guidelines for team tools and practices for delivering data pipelines and reporting tools.
Accountable for delivery of projects and programmes of works associated with the program mangers priorities.
Identifying Continuous Improvement Opportunities for solutions development, based on feedback from team and observations of process and deliverables.
What you’ll bring
A commitment to the safety and wellbeing of yourself and your team
Leadership experience and a passion for bringing out the best in your team
A project management lens where you can keep all stakeholders focused and working safely together to achieve the end goal
Strong problem-solving skills and analytical capabilities with a willingness to grow your skills as well as coaching others
Experience designing and creating reports using Power BI and T-SQL to meet customer needs
Experience creating and maintaining complex and performant SQL queries
Ability to design suitable data architecture behind simple to complex data solutions
Strong knowledge and experience in implementing scrum within a team
Experience in version control
Experience in Azure and Azure DevOps
It will also be beneficial if you have:
Knowledge or experience in the mining industry
A degree in Information Technology, Information System, Data Engineering, Computer Science or similar
Experience working with Business Intelligence reporting suite
Knowledge in Data Science
What we offer
A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
A permanent position working directly for Rio Tinto
A competitive base salary reflective of your skills and experience with Annual incentive program
Comprehensive medical benefits including subsidised private health insurance for employees and immediate family
Attractive share ownership plan
Company provided insurance cover
Extensive salary sacrifice and salary packaging options
Career development and education assistance to further your technical or leadership ambitions
Ongoing access to family-friendly health and medical wellbeing support
Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation/annual, paid parental, sick leave)
Exclusive employee discounts (banking, accommodation, cars, retail and more)
Learning and development opportunities to support your desired technical or leadership career path
Where you’ll be working
Our state-of-the-art Operations Centre (OC) located near the Perth domestic airport, is a key component of our Mine of the Future™ vision. The OC control room operates 24 hours a day, 365 days a year to coordinate our integrated network of mines, rail, power and ports. It enables all our mines, ports and rail systems to be operated from a single location, optimising site activities from 1,500km away.
About Rio Tinto
Every idea, every innovation, every little thing the world calls ‘progress’ begins with
a first step, and someone willing to take it: explorers, inventors, entrepreneurs. Pioneers.
For nearly 150 years, Rio Tinto has been a company of pioneers – generations of people spanning the globe, all with the grit and vision to produce materials essential to human progress.
Our iron ore has shaped skylines from Shanghai to Sydney. Our aluminium – the world’s first to be certified “responsible” – helps planes fly and makes cars lighter. Our copper helps wind turbines power cities and our boron helps feed the world, and explore the universe.
Our diamonds help us celebrate the best parts of life.
Every Voice Matters
At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, women, the LGBTI+ community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.
We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.
Applications close on 10 August 2022 (Rio Tinto reserves the right to remove advertised roles prior to this date)

Reference ID: 41623

Data and Reporting Specialist
Be part of a group that is safety driven and values inclusion and diversity
Work in a cutting-edge technology hub in a diverse and dynamic team
Monday-Friday based at the Perth offices with flexible working from home arrangements.
About the role
All progress begins with pioneers. At Rio Tinto, it begins with you.
We are looking for a Data and Reporting Specialist to make a positive impact to the business by leading a team specialised in data architecture and data and reporting solutions, that drive critical business planning and improvement processes, with better service and support outcomes for Rio Tinto’s Iron Ore business in Western Australia.
Work in a diverse team of talented analysts / developers / leaders, working on a broad range of initiatives with various asset groups, platforms, and stakeholders.
This role is a great opportunity for collaborating closely with stakeholders and the operations across the RTIO business to facilitate effective data and reporting solutions.
We are an open, connected international team of specialists using some of the most exciting data and tools on the planet. We are the world leader in automation and smart mining. We have development programmes that are industry-leading and recognise the unique nature of your role. These provide opportunities to grow your career through a dedicated technical path while being rewarded for your unique skills.
Reporting to the Superintendent Data Reporting Solutions and working in a challenging and exciting environment, you will be:
Leading a team of data and reporting engineers to deliver reporting solutions effectively, to Business Intelligence and automation principles.
Leading the exploration and implementation of leading practices in technology, particularly the DevOps and cloud frameworks, to deliver data and reporting solutions with the best business outcomes.
Defining the technical scopes for sustainable end to end delivery of simple to complex data solutions.
Take ownership of the implementation of Scrum within the team, acting as the product owner and ensuring the team has the required support to be successful in Scrum.
Governing and refining guidelines for team tools and practices for delivering data pipelines and reporting tools.
Accountable for delivery of projects and programmes of works associated with the program mangers priorities.
Identifying Continuous Improvement Opportunities for solutions development, based on feedback from team and observations of process and deliverables.
What you’ll bring
A commitment to the safety and wellbeing of yourself and your team
Leadership experience and a passion for bringing out the best in your team
A project management lens where you can keep all stakeholders focused and working safely together to achieve the end goal
Strong problem-solving skills and analytical capabilities with a willingness to grow your skills as well as coaching others
Experience designing and creating reports using Power BI and T-SQL to meet customer needs
Experience creating and maintaining complex and performant SQL queries
Ability to design suitable data architecture behind simple to complex data solutions
Strong knowledge and experience in implementing scrum within a team
Experience in version control
Experience in Azure and Azure DevOps
It will also be beneficial if you have:
Knowledge or experience in the mining industry
A degree in Information Technology, Information System, Data Engineering, Computer Science or similar
Experience working with Business Intelligence reporting suite
Knowledge in Data Science
What we offer
A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
A permanent position working directly for Rio Tinto
A competitive base salary reflective of your skills and experience with Annual incentive program
Comprehensive medical benefits including subsidised private health insurance for employees and immediate family
Attractive share ownership plan
Company provided insurance cover
Extensive salary sacrifice and salary packaging options
Career development and education assistance to further your technical or leadership ambitions
Ongoing access to family-friendly health and medical wellbeing support
Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation/annual, paid parental, sick leave)
Exclusive employee discounts (banking, accommodation, cars, retail and more)
Learning and development opportunities to support your desired technical or leadership career path
Where you’ll be working
Our state-of-the-art Operations Centre (OC) located near the Perth domestic airport, is a key component of our Mine of the Future™ vision. The OC control room operates 24 hours a day, 365 days a year to coordinate our integrated network of mines, rail, power and ports. It enables all our mines, ports and rail systems to be operated from a single location, optimising site activities from 1,500km away.
About Rio Tinto
Every idea, every innovation, every little thing the world calls ‘progress’ begins with
a first step, and someone willing to take it: explorers, inventors, entrepreneurs. Pioneers.
For nearly 150 years, Rio Tinto has been a company of pioneers – generations of people spanning the globe, all with the grit and vision to produce materials essential to human progress.
Our iron ore has shaped skylines from Shanghai to Sydney. Our aluminium – the world’s first to be certified “responsible” – helps planes fly and makes cars lighter. Our copper helps wind turbines power cities and our boron helps feed the world, and explore the universe.
Our diamonds help us celebrate the best parts of life.
Every Voice Matters
At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, women, the LGBTI+ community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.
We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.

Information Systems and Technology (IS&T) Delivery Partner – Part Time or Full Time
We are open to considering diverse ways of working to tailor the role to candidates seeking flexibility. As such, we are equally interested in candidates seeking either part-time or full-time work.
Be part of a team working with state-of-the-art technology to maintain and improve our Iron Ore capacity and supply chain.
Inclusive working environment where people are valued and respected.
Permanent role, based in Perth.
About the role
We have a new opportunity for an IS&T Delivery Partner to play pivotal roles in ensuring Rio Tinto Iron ore obtain continual value from their core technology assets while identifying, planning, costing, and supporting new project requirements.
As the preferred candidates, you will develop an in-depth understanding of your business stakeholder’s key priorities while identifying appropriate options and solutions to their requirements. Additionally, you will ensure the proper teams within IS&T are involved in both delivery and support.
This role is an excellent opportunity for performance-motivated team players to manage Rio Tinto Iron Ore business relationships. You will actively influence and implement supporting technology and digital strategies, roadmaps, and demand. You will also lead multi-disciplinary teams to execute prioritised initiatives and projects.
Reporting to the IS&T Business Partner RTIO (Rio Tinto Iron Ore) Studies and Major Projects, working in a collaborative and supportive team within IS&T APAC West, you will:
Build solid and enduring customer relationships while maintaining open, transparent, and regular communications with key stakeholders - including internal colleagues within the broader IS&T teams.
Develop a deep understanding of customer project pipelines, operations, business processes and strategic priorities
Provide input and insight on customers' technology strategies and initiatives to achieve their business objectives in line with IS&T’s broader strategy and standards.
Understand technology partner performance, and hold suppliers (internal & external) accountable for the delivery of products and services
Triage and prioritise incoming demand requests - clearly defining the business problem, value, and opportunity to enable appropriate resources to be identified to support the requirement.
Provide support in high-level scoping and estimation of effort required to deliver initiatives and products.
What you will bring:
A consultative can-do attitude, analytical mindset, and complex problem-solving abilities
A focus on delivering customer value, with the ability to rapidly understand customers' business priorities and become a trusted advisor
Excellent written and verbal communications across technical and non-technical stakeholders
The ability to prioritise competing customer demands to deliver the best outcome for the business - based on cost, value, and risk
A passion for innovation, backed by a demonstrated ability to work in multi-disciplinary teams to deliver value-enabling technology projects and products
Experience in a product and capability-based environment and familiarity with Agile ways of working ideally within an asset-intensive industry (e.g., Mining and metals, oil and gas, supply chain management or logistics).
A broad understanding of established and emerging technological trends that can help enable competitive advantage (i.e., Cloud platforms, internet of things (IoT), process automation, data science, citizen development etc.)
What we offer
Be recognised for your contribution, thinking and hard work, and go home knowing you have helped the world progress.
A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
A permanent position working directly for Rio Tinto
A competitive base salary reflective of your skills and experience with an annual incentive program
Comprehensive medical benefits, including subsidised private health insurance for employees and immediate family
Attractive share ownership plan
Company provided insurance cover
Extensive salary sacrifice & salary packaging options
Career development & education assistance to further your technical or leadership ambitions
Ongoing access to family-friendly health and medical wellbeing support
Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation/annual, paid parental, sick leave)
Exclusive employee discounts (banking, accommodation, cars, retail and more).
Where you will be working
Rio Tinto Information Systems and Technology (IS&T) operates to enable better alignment with customer priorities, end-to-end accountability and flexibility to prioritise critical work. The function provides solutions that are aligned with current and future business requirements through the development and ongoing delivery of IT strategy and solution roadmaps. Through appropriate governance, consultative processes, and the use of industry best practices, IS&T also ensures that emerging technologies and innovative ideas are constantly evaluated, considered, and adopted, to provide easy-to-use, best-in-class solutions and services.

About BHP

At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success.

Come and be a part of this success.

About the Role

Reporting to the Superintendent Improvement, you will be passionate about transformation and improving the business.

You will be highly adept at deriving insights from a range of different data sources, visualising and communicating these insights to guide leadership decision-making, resource prioritisation, and ultimately deliver high-value projects. This role is suited to an energetic, enthusiastic and self-motivated individual who is seeking an influential role within a leading organisation.

Additional key responsibilities will include:
Investigate and solve complex problems using a structured problem-solving approach.
Work closely with stakeholders across Port and key functions to ensure that the relevant business problems are defined, including setting the problem context, understanding the business requirements and success measures, and managing potential challenges.
Facilitating and leading high value, multi-disciplinary projects across Port using BHP’s Operating System and proven Project Management methodologies.
Performing constraints analysis, correlation analysis, modelling and performance benchmarking to identify opportunities and bottlenecks.
Influencing and upskilling the wider Port Improvement Team to achieve increased data and digital literacy, to maximise the value we can extract from our data assets and better support our customers.
Maintaining strategic relationships with our customers and functional stakeholders to achieve optimal outcomes for Port.
Storytelling using different forms of data visualisation.
About You

To be successful in this role, you will have experience turning insights from complex data into high impact business cases. In addition to your technical acumen, you have a strong focus on relationships and value realisation; using your refined collaboration and engagement skills to build effective partnerships with our customers and functions and communicate improvement value across the business.

In addition, we are looking for the following skills and experience:
Tertiary qualification (Bachelors or above) within one of the following fields: Business, Data Science, Computer Science, IT, Engineering or Mathematics.
Proficiency in statistical programming (R, Python) and query languages (MS SQL, Oracle SQL).
Proficiency in data visualisation and business intelligence software (PowerBI, TIBCO Spotfire, PI Vision).
Experience with Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps and Power Automate).
Experience using Project Management systems / solutions.
Experience in performance improvement ideation and hypothesis development, including exploring and proposing new ideas that may have benefits for the operation and business.
Capability in project scoping, project planning and executing work using a disciplined approach to attain project goals.
Strong analytical, critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills.
Strong presentation and communication skills, and ability to influence stakeholders within different areas of expertise.

Other attributes you may have would include some or all of the following:
Practical experience in mining, minerals processing and resource industries, or equivalent heavy industries, which may include experience in operations or consulting in these areas.
Lean Six Sigma or other Business Improvement qualifications.
Location

In this full-time permanent position, you will be you will be based at Port Hedland on a fly-in fly-out 5D2X,4D3X roster.

Port Hedland is home to our port and rail operations and is the largest regional centre in North West Australia. The outstanding facilities at the FIFO villages include, a fully equipped gym, TV lounge and games rooms. Additionally, you will have access to the state-of-the-art aquatic and sporting facilities in the town of Port Hedland. All rooms at the villages have their own en-suite bathroom, television, refrigerator and air-conditioning.

Alternatively, residential base could be an option, and in this case you will be working on Monday-Friday roster.

The 20,000-strong population in this coastal town enjoys well-established education services, entertainment, shopping and medical facilities. Its beaches and mangroves are home to an abundance of fish and other wildlife. Within driving distance are the spectacular Broome, Karratha and Karijini national Park. As this is a residential position you will also be provided with subsidised rental accommodation in addition to power and water subsidies.

About Our Process

At BHP, we are committed to employing individuals who align with the BHP Charter Values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks.

To ensure the safety and wellbeing of our people, BHP requires employees in Australia to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 in line with BHP’s Covid Policy and any relevant State health directives. If you are applying for a role at BHP please consider this requirement when submitting your application. BHP will also adhere to any relevant health directives that may be made that affects our workforce.

Supporting a Diverse Workforce
The size and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance-based bonuses and a unique BHP employee share program.

At BHP, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and we encourage applications from women and Indigenous people. We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.

Botanist
A dynamic and varied role which allows you to think creatively
Engage and partner across the business
Perth CBD | Perm full time | Great employee benefits
Role will require site based field work from time to time
About the role
All progress begins with pioneers. At Rio Tinto, it begins with you.
We are looking for a Botanist to join our Biological Assessments team in Perth (with occasional site travel). Focusing on Botany within the Pilbara region these roles will be engaged on a full time permanent basis.
This role is a great opportunity for a motivated, safety conscious professional to join a multi-disciplined team; applying knowledge of relevant legislation and technical guides to Pilbara-focused environmental approvals and associated surveys.
We are an open, connected global team that includes some of the industry’s best and brightest minds. We offer competitive, performance-focused remuneration and a wide range of benefits to reward your contribution. With a global reach, the opportunities to develop and grow your career are broad and exciting.
Reporting to the Specialist Biological Assessments, you will:
Independently lead biological surveys in remote Pilbara areas
Undertake effective survey planning including, sampling design, logistics and health and safety
Prepare technical reports, data, analysis and provide technical advice to support government and environmental approval requirements
Contribute to the development and improvement of biological assessment methods, processes and technologies to ensure continuous improvement
Build effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders and technical specialists
Contribute toward an inclusive culture through collaboration with peers across the broader Environmental Approvals team
What you’ll bring
To be successfully considered for this role, you will have:
Tertiary qualifications in botany science or related.
Demonstrated experience as a field botanist/biologist, ideally within the resources sector
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills coupled with an ability to think on your feet and make sound rational decisions
Effective verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to quickly develop positive and robust relationships with stakeholders
Experience with GIS software, preferably ArcGIS
Experience/awareness of remote sensing techniques and environmental applications
Must hold Australian working rights (international relocation not provided)
What we offer
Be recognised for your contribution, your thinking and your hard work, and go home knowing you’ve helped the world progress.
A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
Flexible working from home arrangements as per operational requirements
A competitive base salary reflective of your skills and experience with annual incentive program
Comprehensive medical benefits including subsidised private health insurance for employees and immediate family
Attractive share ownership plan
Company provided insurance cover
Extensive salary sacrifice & salary packaging options
Career development & education assistance to further your technical or leadership ambitions
Ongoing access to family-friendly health and medical wellbeing support
Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation/annual, paid parental, sick leave)
Exclusive employee discounts (banking, accommodation, cars, retail and more)
About Rio Tinto
Every idea, every innovation, every little thing the world calls ‘progress’ begins with a first step, and someone willing to take it: explorers, inventors, entrepreneurs. Pioneers.
For nearly 150 years, Rio Tinto has been a company of pioneers – generations of people spanning the globe, all with the grit and vision to produce materials essential to human progress.
Our iron ore has shaped skylines from Shanghai to Sydney. Our aluminium – the world’s first to be certified “responsible” – helps planes fly and makes cars lighter. Our copper helps wind turbines power cities and our boron helps feed the world, and explore the universe.

Our diamonds help us celebrate the best parts of life.
Where you’ll be working
Perth based but with a working focus on the Pilbara region of Western Australia. In the Pilbara region of Western Australia, we own an integrated portfolio of iron ore assets supported by functional teams in the Perth hub: a world-class, integrated network of 16 mines, four independent port terminals, a 1,700 kilometre rail network and related infrastructure – all designed to respond rapidly to changes in demand.
We are one of the world’s leading producers and exporters of iron ore.

ENGINEER - WATER MANAGEMENT
Be part of a group that is safety driven and values inclusion
Permanent employment which includes a huge range of additional benefits
Residential role based in Tom Price on 5/2/4/3 roster
About the role
All progress begins with pioneers. At Rio Tinto, it begins with you.
We are looking for an Engineer - Water Management to join the Water Management team at Tom Price.
This role is for applicants residing in or willing to relocate to Tom Price, Pilbara, WA and is offered as a 5/2/4/3 roster.
Reporting to the Superintendent Production Dewatering and Projects and working in a collaborative community of stakeholders, you will be:
Providing technical support to the Superintendent and the Dewatering Supervisor Team
Supporting the development of the water management schedule/ plan
Analysing and interpreting a broad array of water data
Coordinating and in regular communication with the Hydrology and Mine Technical Services teams
Providing daily and long-term water management advice to ensure the pit and site water balance requirements are adhered to
Providing technical guidance to the business on the capital acquisition process and completing associated paperwork
Establishing and maintaining positive relationships with both internal and external stakeholders
Facilitating the MTS alignment meeting and 6 weekly water steering committee meeting
Monitoring water management KPI’s
In addition to paying competitively and providing great benefits packages, we want you to live the lifestyle that is right for you and your family. And because of our size and scale, there are many opportunities to learn, grow and do more than you ever thought possible.
Every hour of every shift, your safety and wellbeing is our number one priority. We do the work only if it is safe, and we invest to make sure every member of the team has the quality tools they need to do their job.
What you will bring
A commitment to the safety of yourself and your team
Environmental Science or Engineering degree is desirable but not essential
Class C driving licence license
Experience in mine site water management
Experience in mine regulations and reporting is desirable

A safety-focused and inclusive working environment
A competitive salary package with annual cash incentive awards (STIP)
Access to top tier family-friendly health and medical programs
A comprehensive leave policy that covers all moments that matter in life (vacation/annual, paid parental leave, short term sick leave, paid holidays)
Ongoing individual wellbeing support for you and your family for personal and professional matters
Generous Rio Tinto employee share program

A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
Flexible working from home arrangements as per operational requirements
A competitive base salary reflective of your skills and experience with annual incentive program
Comprehensive medical benefits including subsidised private health insurance for employees and immediate family
Attractive share ownership plan
Company provided insurance cover

Career development & education assistance to further your technical or leadership ambitions

About Rio Tinto
Every idea, every innovation, every little thing the world calls ‘progress’ begins with a first step, and someone willing to take it: explorers, inventors, entrepreneurs. Pioneers.
For nearly 150 years, Rio Tinto has been a company of pioneers – generations of people spanning the globe, all with the grit and vision to produce materials essential to human progress.
Our iron ore has shaped skylines from Shanghai to Sydney. Our aluminium – the world’s first to be certified “responsible” – helps planes fly and makes cars lighter. Our copper helps wind turbines power cities and our boron helps feed the world, and explore the universe.

Our diamonds help us celebrate the best parts of life.
Where you’ll be working
Perth based but with a working focus on the Pilbara region of Western Australia. In the Pilbara region of Western Australia, we own an integrated portfolio of iron ore assets supported by functional teams in the Perth hub: a world-class, integrated network of 16 mines, four independent port terminals, a 1,700 kilometre rail network and related infrastructure – all designed to respond rapidly to changes in demand.
We are one of the world’s leading producers and exporters of iron ore.
Every Voice Matters
At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, women, the LGBTI+ community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.
We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.

About the role
All progress begins with pioneers. At Rio Tinto, it begins with you.
We are looking for an Engineer - Water Management to join the Water Management team at Tom Price.
This role is for applicants residing in or willing to relocate to Tom Price, Pilbara, WA and is offered as a 5/2/4/3 roster.
Reporting to the Superintendent Production Dewatering and Projects and working in a collaborative community of stakeholders, you will be:
Providing technical support to the Superintendent and the Dewatering Supervisor Team
Supporting the development of the water management schedule/ plan
Analysing and interpreting a broad array of water data
Coordinating and in regular communication with the Hydrology and Mine Technical Services teams
Providing daily and long-term water management advice to ensure the pit and site water balance requirements are adhered to
Providing technical guidance to the business on the capital acquisition process and completing associated paperwork
Establishing and maintaining positive relationships with both internal and external stakeholders
Facilitating the MTS alignment meeting and 6 weekly water steering committee meeting
Monitoring water management KPI’s
In addition to paying competitively and providing great benefits packages, we want you to live the lifestyle that is right for you and your family. And because of our size and scale, there are many opportunities to learn, grow and do more than you ever thought possible.

A commitment to the safety of yourself and your team
Environmental Science or Engineering degree is desirable but not essential
Class C driving licence license

Mine Geologists – Pilbara
Fantastic 18 Weeks paid parental leave - applicable to both care-givers
Industry leading career development opportunities
Family-friendly FIFO roster, 8 days on, 6 days off
About the role
All progress begins with pioneers. At Rio Tinto, it begins with you.
We are looking for enthusiastic Mine Geologists to join our Mine Technical Services Team.
Based at our Iron Ore operations in the Pilbara, we have opportunities for Mine Geologists to provide accurate geological, grade and predictive metallurgical information critical for the success of the mining operation.
Reporting to the Senior Mine Geologist, you will be involved in monitoring reconciliations between predicted and actual grade and tonnes and providing accurate ore delineation and grade estimations to facilitate short to medium term planning. Whilst ensuring compliance with QAQC standards for geological data collection, integrity and interpretation you will have the opportunity to undertake a variety of geology project work and provide geological input into material attribute characteristics and improvements.
We are an open, connected international team of technical specialists using some of the most exciting data and tools on the planet. We are the world leader in automation and smart mining. We have technical development programmes that are industry-leading and recognise the unique nature of your role. These provide opportunities to grow your career through a dedicated technical path while being rewarded for your unique skills.
About you
Ideally, the successful candidate will have the following qualificationsand experience:
Bachelor of Science in Geological Science/EarthScience or equivalent (Geology) with practical experience in mine geology
Demonstrated mine geology experience withan understanding of Geo-metallurgy OR exploration and evaluationtechniques
Current WA "C Class" Driver’s License
Experience with geological data collection,validation, interpretation and QAQC
Demonstrated knowledge of mining/mapping andmodelling software packages (preferably LeapFrog, Vulcan, ArcMap and acquire)
Excellent communication skills and drive forcontinuous improvement
A strong safety mindset

Be recognised for your contribution, your thinking and your hard work,and go home knowing you’ve helped the world progress.

About the role
All progress begins with pioneers. At Rio Tinto, it begins with you.

About BHP

At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success.

Come and be a part of this success.

About the Role

Reporting to the Superintendent Improvement, you will be passionate about transformation and improving the business.

You will be highly adept at deriving insights from a range of different data sources, visualising and communicating these insights to guide leadership decision-making, resource prioritisation, and ultimately deliver high-value projects. This role is suited to an energetic, enthusiastic and self-motivated individual who is seeking an influential role within a leading organisation.

Additional key responsibilities will include:
Investigate and solve complex problems using a structured problem-solving approach.
Work closely with stakeholders across Port and key functions to ensure that the relevant business problems are defined, including setting the problem context, understanding the business requirements and success measures, and managing potential challenges.
Facilitating and leading high value, multi-disciplinary projects across Port using BHP’s Operating System and proven Project Management methodologies.
Performing constraints analysis, correlation analysis, modelling and performance benchmarking to identify opportunities and bottlenecks.
Influencing and upskilling the wider Port Improvement Team to achieve increased data and digital literacy, to maximise the value we can extract from our data assets and better support our customers.
Maintaining strategic relationships with our customers and functional stakeholders to achieve optimal outcomes for Port.
Storytelling using different forms of data visualisation.
About You

To be successful in this role, you will have experience turning insights from complex data into high impact business cases. In addition to your technical acumen, you have a strong focus on relationships and value realisation; using your refined collaboration and engagement skills to build effective partnerships with our customers and functions and communicate improvement value across the business.

In addition, we are looking for the following skills and experience:
Tertiary qualification (Bachelors or above) within one of the following fields: Business, Data Science, Computer Science, IT, Engineering or Mathematics.
Proficiency in statistical programming (R, Python) and query languages (MS SQL, Oracle SQL).
Proficiency in data visualisation and business intelligence software (PowerBI, TIBCO Spotfire, PI Vision).
Experience with Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps and Power Automate).
Experience using Project Management systems / solutions.
Experience in performance improvement ideation and hypothesis development, including exploring and proposing new ideas that may have benefits for the operation and business.
Capability in project scoping, project planning and executing work using a disciplined approach to attain project goals.
Strong analytical, critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills.
Strong presentation and communication skills, and ability to influence stakeholders within different areas of expertise.

Other attributes you may have would include some or all of the following:
Practical experience in mining, minerals processing and resource industries, or equivalent heavy industries, which may include experience in operations or consulting in these areas.
Lean Six Sigma or other Business Improvement qualifications.
Location

In this full-time permanent position, you will be you will be based at Port Hedland on a fly-in fly-out 5D2X,4D3X roster.

Port Hedland is home to our port and rail operations and is the largest regional centre in North West Australia. The outstanding facilities at the FIFO villages include, a fully equipped gym, TV lounge and games rooms. Additionally, you will have access to the state-of-the-art aquatic and sporting facilities in the town of Port Hedland. All rooms at the villages have their own en-suite bathroom, television, refrigerator and air-conditioning.

Alternatively, residential base could be an option, and in this case you will be working on Monday-Friday roster.

The 20,000-strong population in this coastal town enjoys well-established education services, entertainment, shopping and medical facilities. Its beaches and mangroves are home to an abundance of fish and other wildlife. Within driving distance are the spectacular Broome, Karratha and Karijini national Park. As this is a residential position you will also be provided with subsidised rental accommodation in addition to power and water subsidies.
Reference Number – 57397

This opportunity is currently only open to candidates with the right to work in Australia.
We reserve the right to commence recruitment proceedings immediately.
You may be requested to complete a video assessment as part of the initial recruitment process. Video assessment is only applied to external applicant.
Application closes on Tuesday, 16th Aug 2022. While Virtual Assessment closes on Thursday, 18th Aug 2022 (not applicable for Internal BHP applicants). Please note late applications will not be accepted.

About Our Process

At BHP, we are committed to employing individuals who align with the BHP Charter Values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks.

To ensure the safety and wellbeing of our people, BHP requires employees in Australia to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 in line with BHP’s Covid Policy and any relevant State health directives. If you are applying for a role at BHP please consider this requirement when submitting your application. BHP will also adhere to any relevant health directives that may be made that affects our workforce.

Supporting a Diverse Workforce
The size and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance-based bonuses and a unique BHP employee share program.

At BHP, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and we encourage applications from women and Indigenous people. We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.

Superintendent, Field Hydrogeology
Drive technical leadership and best practice in hydrogeology and hydrology data capture
Lead one of the largest and diverse field teams of their type
Influence and drive a culture of continuous improvement
Permanent opportunity which includes a huge range of additional benefits
FIFO 5:2, 4:3 roster
About the role
All progress begins with pioneers. At Rio Tinto, it begins with you.
We are an open, connected international team of technical specialists using some of the most exciting data and tools on the planet. We are the world leader in automation and smart mining. We have technical development programmes that are industry-leading and recognise the unique nature of your role. These provide opportunities to grow your career through a dedicated technical path while being rewarded for your unique skills.
We are looking for a Superintendent, Field Hydrogeology to join our Iron Ore business and lead an established team of 30+ hydrogeologists and hydro field technicians. Working together with our industry leading water-well drilling partners, your team is responsible for the acquisition of hydrogeology and hydrology data that underpins water-related technical guidance and mine water management across the entire life of our Tier 1 Pilbara assets, from development, implementation, operation, and closure.
Reporting to the Manager, Water Resource Evaluation, you will:
Manage the safe and efficient execution of Pilbara-wide water monitoring activities
Provide active safety and technical leadership of an existing Field Hydrogeology team, while playing a key part in the development of a newly formed Water Monitoring team
Develop and maintain data collection standards
Work closely with contract partners and CMS representatives to ensure regular constructive feedback and fair performance.
Advocate and drive adherence to scientific method in the design and execution of hydrogeological investigations.
Work collaboratively with both internal and external stakeholders to drive continuous improvement through adherence to PDCA (plan-do-check-act)
Establish effective working relationships with key operational stakeholders ensuring effective portfolio communications
Provide regular and routine input to the leadership at a department and divisional level
Recruit, coach and mentor a mid-size team of Field Hydrogeologists and Field Hydro Technicians in their roles to supervise the drilling, installation and testing of water supply, dewatering and groundwater monitoring infrastructure
What you’ll bring
A commitment to the safety of yourself and others, creating and maintaining a safe workplace
Demonstrated complex problem-solving abilitiesto deliver solutions across the business
Proven ability to build positive relationships
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
A good understanding of the application of different hydrogeological drilling methods in Pilbara terrain
A good understanding of best practice water-well construction, development and testing
A good appreciation of water management best practices across through planning, data acquisition, interpretation and reporting.
Provide context to your team that is meaningful to them and the work that we do
Create a positive environment focused on constructive feedback
A current manual WA Driver’s license
A minimum bachelor’s degree in geology, hydrogeology, relevant science or engineering field
It will be beneficial if you have:
Post-graduate training in water-related field
Be highly attuned to the challenges associated with water management in mining and the Pilbara
Understanding of WA regulatory environment applicable to water
What we offer
Be recognised for your contribution, your thinking and your hard work, and go home knowing you’ve helped the world progress.
A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
A permanent position working directly for Rio Tinto
A competitive base salary reflective of your skills and experience with annual incentive program
Comprehensive medical benefits including subsidised private health insurance for employees and immediate family
Attractive share ownership plan
Company provided insurance cover
Extensive salary sacrifice & salary packaging options
Career development & education assistance to further your technical or leadership ambitions

Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation/annual, paid parental, sick leave)

Your Job
This role is only open to candidates who are already based in Australia and you'll be working remotely with a team at Indeed Tokyo. We are also open to considering visa sponsorship or relocation to Japan.

If you are an engineer who's passionate about building innovative products that scale to tens of millions of pageviews a day, Indeed is looking for you. Indeed offers smart developers like you a multi-faceted development ecosystem with short release cycles. Every week sees the new release of multiple products that meet the growing needs of millions of job seekers worldwide.

As a full-stack software engineer at Indeed, you’ll be a part of a small, highly talented team of people working end-to-end on the products and services that power the world’s #1 job site. You’ll have the opportunity to impact everything from user-facing pixels on both desktop and mobile, to the backend data stores, and everything between.

At Indeed, we love data. As a part of a highly data-driven organization, you won’t have to guess at the impact you’re having; you’ll leverage our large-scale data analysis infrastructure to define, measure, and test your hypotheses and deliver the best possible experience for the jobseeker. At Indeed, our primary technology stack is Java-based, but we believe strongly in using the right tool for the right job. As such, we’re rapidly adopting emerging best-of-breed technologies and incorporating them into our stack. This includes things like React/Redux, React Native, Python/Django, MongoDB, Go, and Kubernetes, to name a few. Additionally, sometimes the right tool for the job doesn’t exist, so we’ve created and open-sourced a number of our core systems. You can explore them on Github and YouTube.
Who You Are
Responsibilities

Design, develop, deploy, and maintain services, systems, and user-facing applications helping 200 million jobseekers every month
Conceive of and implement new features to help connect job seekers and employers
Continually improve code quality, performance and reliability

We're looking for someone who

Has a passion for building elegant, scalable software that solves practical problems and helps people get jobs
Thrives in a highly collaborative, cross-functional environment
Loves to learn and develop new skills continuously
Has a strong sense of ownership in every application they build

Requirements

BS in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience
Significant practical experience with at least one of the following languages: Java, C++, C#, Python, Go
Demonstrated ability to operate as a high-performing member of a small, cross-functional team
5+ years experience in software development

Preferred Qualifications

Experience building solutions for high traffic web sites
Real-world, experience with one or more of the following, at scale: MySQL, Hadoop (CDH5), ElasticSearch, RabbitMQ
Demonstrated ability to work with Product Management to define priorities, and provide technical direction for a small team (3-5) of engineers
Who we are
The Enterprise business organization is focused on delivering value for Indeed’s largest customers. We are driven by Indeed’s mission to help all people get jobs by helping enterprise employers make the best hires, at scale. Our work is very important to us as Enterprise employers are consistently rated among the top places to work globally. Our approach is multi-faceted with many dedicated product and engineering professionals driving innovation with our biggest clients in mind.
Our Mission
As the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.

(*comScore Total Visits, September 2021)
Salary Range Disclaimer
The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.
Salary Range Transparency
Sydney 173,000 - 251,000 AUD per year

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neurodiversity, disability, age, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds. Working together with our industry leading water-well drilling partners, your team is responsible for the acquisition of hydrogeology and hydrology data that underpins water-related technical guidance and mine water management across the entire life of our Tier 1 Pilbara assets, from development, implementation, operation, and closure.
Reporting to the Manager, Water Resource Evaluation, you will:
Manage the safe and efficient execution of Pilbara-wide water monitoring activities
Provide active safety and technical leadership of an existing Field Hydrogeology team, while playing a key part in the development of a newly formed Water Monitoring team
Develop and maintain data collection standards
Work closely with contract partners and CMS representatives to ensure regular constructive feedback and fair performance.
Advocate and drive adherence to scientific method in the design and execution of hydrogeological investigations.
Work collaboratively with both internal and external stakeholders to drive continuous improvement through adherence to PDCA (plan-do-check-act)
Establish effective working relationships with key operational stakeholders ensuring effective portfolio communications
Provide regular and routine input to the leadership at a department and divisional level
Recruit, coach and mentor a mid-size team of Field Hydrogeologists and Field Hydro Technicians in their roles to supervise the drilling, installation and testing of water supply, dewatering and groundwater monitoring infrastructure
What you’ll bring
A commitment to the safety of yourself and others, creating and maintaining a safe workplace
Demonstrated complex problem-solving abilitiesto deliver solutions across the business
Proven ability to build positive relationships
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
A good understanding of the application of different hydrogeological drilling methods in Pilbara terrain
A good understanding of best practice water-well construction, development and testing
A good appreciation of water management best practices across through planning, data acquisition, interpretation and reporting.
Provide context to your team that is meaningful to them and the work that we do
Create a positive environment focused on constructive feedback
A current manual WA Driver’s license
A minimum bachelor’s degree in geology, hydrogeology, relevant science or engineering field
It will be beneficial if you have:
Post-graduate training in water-related field
Be highly attuned to the challenges associated with water management in mining and the Pilbara
Understanding of WA regulatory environment applicable to water
What we offer
Be recognised for your contribution, your thinking and your hard work, and go home knowing you’ve helped the world progress.
A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
A permanent position working directly for Rio Tinto
A competitive base salary reflective of your skills and experience with annual incentive program
Comprehensive medical benefits including subsidised private health insurance for employees and immediate family
Attractive share ownership plan
Company provided insurance cover
Extensive salary sacrifice & salary packaging options
Career development & education assistance to further your technical or leadership ambitions
Ongoing access to family-friendly health and medical wellbeing support
Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation/annual, paid parental, sick leave)

Prominent WA brand and purpose driven organisation
2-year fixed term, full time position in Leederville
Salary Level 4: $91,321 + Super
Advancing your career will advance our community too
Every Western Australian needs water to survive, and thrive. So, we are looking for people who have a passion for meaningful, innovative work to help bring our vision to life, while facing up to the challenges of climate change.
You'll get to work flexibly alongside collaborators, creators, thinkers and doers to make a difference to lives all over WA.
Plus, you'll get the opportunity to carve a career path as diverse as the different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives of our 3500+ people. Come thrive with us!
About the role:
We currently have a 2-year fixed-term opportunity available for a Coordinator to join our Water Efficiency Partnerships team in Leederville.
The purpose of the role is to drive the Waterwise Council Program to build cooperative working relationships and foster demand management capability to improve water efficiency, climate resilience and liveability. The Program is a partnership between Water Corporation and the Department of Water and Environmental Regulation.
What the role will involve:
Coordinate and administer the Waterwise Council Program to drive engagement with local governments and their communities in water efficiency and meet relevant corporate objectives.
Initiate and coordinate activities to drive waterwise outcomes e.g. training, case studies, events and other communications activities.
Initiate and deliver projects to drive local government and community water efficiency outcomes.
Review, develop and maintain waterwise content on the Waterwise Program section of the website and evaluate effectiveness as a resource for local government to improve water efficiency.
Ensure that internal relationships are used to drive water efficiency engagement with end customers utilising all available touchpoints, eg. stakeholder managers, regions, engagement officers, Development Services etc.
Key skills and experience:
Relevant Tertiary level qualification, or progression towards, in science, business, communications or other related disciplines, or substantial experience in a large commercially focussed state-wide organisation providing customer related service.
Considerable experience in developing and managing relationships with stakeholders and customers, including the ability to negotiate and influence behaviour.
Considerable experience in computer-based customer accounting systems and proven ability to analyse and interpret data and prepare reports.
Considerable experience in managing a customer focussed program requiring strong organisational skills.
Sound knowledge of water conservation and water use efficiency practices.
Demonstrates advanced change management capability.
Apply: If you are interested in the above opportunity, please submit a covering letter and resume that best demonstrates your ability to meet the requirements of the role.
Applications close 7 August 2022

As part of the recruitment process, you will be required to complete Pre-Employment screening which may include a medical, qualification check, police clearance and Australian working rights check.

We reserve the right to withdraw this ad prior to the closing date.

About BHP

At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success.

Come and be a part of this success.

About the Role

Provides technical expertise in the execution of workforce listening and advanced analytics programs.

Partners across HR to develop and execute the strategic / advanced analytics program, focusing on the application of predictive / prescriptive analytics to solve BHP’s strategic people challenges.
Runs and enhances BHP’s workforce listening strategy, including the Engagement and Perception Survey and other Qualtrics programs.
Provides advanced workforce Analysis and insights to BHP leaders, including support for ELT and Board presentations.
Develops and undertakes strategic workforce modelling and insights program in partnership with Strategic Workforce Planning teams.
Develops and maintains the underpinning data and data infrastructure to support advanced people analytics.
About You

Advanced statistical analysis
Working with Microsoft PowerBI / Spotfire programs.
Coding with Python or R
Survey & Research Design
Advanced Data Science training

About Our Process

At BHP, we are committed to employing individuals who align with the BHP Charter Values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, due diligence checks, right to work checks, and/or reference checks.

To ensure the safety and wellbeing of our people, BHP requires employees in Australia to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 in line with BHP’s Covid Policy and any relevant State health directives. If you are applying for a role at BHP please consider this requirement when submitting your application. BHP will also adhere to any relevant health directives that may be made that affects our workforce.

Supporting a Diverse Workforce
The size and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance-based bonuses and a unique BHP employee share program.

At BHP, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and we encourage applications from women and Indigenous people. We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.

About Rio Tinto

Every idea, every innovation, every little thing the world calls ‘progress’ begins with a first step, and someone willing to take it: explorers, inventors, entrepreneurs. Pioneers.

For nearly 150 years, Rio Tinto has been a company of pioneers –generations of people spanning the globe, all with the grit and vision to produce materials essential to human progress. Our iron ore has shaped skylines from Shanghai to Sydney. Our aluminium –the world’s first to be certified “responsible” –helps planes fly and makes cars lighter. Our copper helps wind turbines power cities and our boron helps feed the world and explore the universe. Our diamonds help us celebrate the best parts of life.

Where you’ll be working

Working Monday to Friday, you will be based at the Central Park building, location in Perth CBD.

In the Pilbara region of Western Australia, we own an integrated portfolio of iron ore assets: a world-class, integrated network of 16 mines, four independent port terminals, a 1,700 kilometre rail network and related infrastructure –all designed to respond rapidly to changes in demand. We are one of the world’s leading producers and exporters of iron ore.

Every Voice Matters

We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome –they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.

Applications close on 10 August 2022 (Rio Tinto reserves the right to remove advertised roles prior to this date)

What's on offer
Competitive Salary
Work across leading edge technology in a highly experienced team
Experience within an innovative and creative business
Flexible home/office work arrangements
Salary Continuance insurance for all permanent employees
About the Position
We are looking for a Data Specialist to join the Data Centre team in Perth, to assist in processing and delivering data and digital products to our clients. The Data Centre works with Project Managers and Project Teams to create and maintain high quality datasets and deliverables.
As a data driven company, Fugro collects, collates, synthesize, and presents data in digital, interactive and charted formats. The Fugro Marine team acquires hydrographic, bathymetric, metocean, geophysical and geotechnical data using remotely operated vehicles (ROV), unmanned surface vessels (USV), dedicated survey vessels and vessels of opportunity.
Fugro Data Specialists are not made from a single mould. They encapsulate all types of professional abilities, including data science, data analytics, geomatics, surveying, cartography, engineering, multibeam processing and geophysics. Data Specialists have a passion for data, so an interest in computers, computer sciences, data and data processing will be a distinct advantage. Prior experience in the marine industry or surveying is not required.
Responsibilities include
Demonstration of Fugro’s core values;
Facilitate the delivery of data to a wide variety of teams
Contribution to the collation, synthesis and presentation of project and archived data
Detailed responsibilities include
Generation of figures and charts
Use of industry and Fugro developed software
Application of GIS and CAD for the presentation of data
Processing of geospatial data, under guidance of others
Achieve the required timeframe for delivery
Adherence to quality protocols
The maintenance of digital databases and electronic files
Essential Qualifications
Recognised qualifications in Spatial Sciences, Computer Sciences, Surveying, Cartography, Geomatics, GIS, Applied Engineering or Engineering.
Desirable skills
Possess excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated problem-solving, decision-making and prioritising skills.
Ability to manage large volumes of information.
Proactively contribute to a teamwork environment.
Agency to develop professional skills.
Committed to delivering exceptional results.
About Fugro
Fugro are the world’s leading, independent provider of geo-data and asset integrity solutions for large constructions, infrastructure and natural resources. We provide the technical data and information required to design, construct and maintain engineering structures and infrastructure in a safe, reliable and efficient manner.
Our Values
https://www.fugro.com/about-fugro/group-overview/our-values
One Fugro
We strive to foster an inclusive environment where everyone feels comfortable to be themselves; all voices heard; all cultures respected. Our employees’ skillsets are diverse, and we treat each other with dignity and respect regardless of race, gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us an individual.
Fugro reserves the right to close this advert at any time.
Applications or interest via recruitment agencies will not be accepted at this time.
Disclaimer for recruitment agencies:
Fugro does not accept any unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies. Acquisition to Fugro Recruitment or any Fugro employee is not appreciated .
