Ongoing, Full-Time Contract
Make a difference utilising your environmental consulting knowledge
Perth Location
About us
Greencap makes the world safer by offering risk management solutions that protect the things we value most - our people, our property, and the environment.
We do this by delivering tailor-made solutions across the breadth of health & safety, property and the environment through our expert services, online solutions, and training offerings.
www.greencap.com.au (http://www.greencap.com.au)
The Role

Reporting to the Team Manager, the Environment Consultant will contribute to the project and account management while also having the technical ability to deliver a wide range of services to our clients. This role will be supported by a team of high performing technical experts.
To be successful in this role, you will be able to demonstrate:
Utilising your technical background to deliver high-quality work in the areas of contaminated land assessment and environmental monitoring.
Conducting a range of field activities including, but not limited to soil and groundwater investigations, groundwater and surface water monitoring, soil vapour/landfill gas, and environmental due diligence assessments
Data management and the compilation of technical reports and presenting findings to clients
Contributing to the region's pipeline of business opportunities that will ensure revenue targets are achieved
Monitoring assigned projects to ensure they meet defined project objectives (i.e. meet client and regulatory needs, timeframes, budget etc.) and regularly communicate with key stakeholders
Contributing to the region's secured work profile by identifying, creating and converting opportunities through proactive client relationship management
About you
To succeed in this role, here's what we need:
A confident Environment Consultant, who is passionate about the environment practice.
Experience working in Contaminated Land practices
Qualifications in a Geology, Hydrogeology, Geotechnical Engineering, Environmental Engineering or Environmental Science
Experience in Environmental Consulting and fieldwork specialising in contaminated land assessments
Familiarity with sampling techniques (e.g. soil and groundwater), drilling procedures, and the environmental regulatory framework would be highly regarded
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to effectively engage and influence at all levels
Competency in GIS, ESDAT and Winlog software is desirable
A current driving licence is essential
Strong analytical skills and reporting
Demonstrated commitment to continuous improvement with a desire to achieve best practice outcomes
Are you ready to join us to make the world safer?
Click the ‘Apply' button below and follow the links to submit your covering letter and CV. To apply, you must be an Australian/New Zealand resident or able to work without restriction in Australia.
As part of our recruitment process and commitment to safety, suitable candidates will be required to undertake background checks which may include a police check, a pre-employment medical assessment, drug and alcohol testing as part of your application process.
Disclaimer: Greencap does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
Greencap promotes and adheres to the principles and practices of diversity

Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we work closely with clients to embrace a transformational approach aimed at benefiting all stakeholders—empowering organizations to grow, build sustainable competitive advantage, and drive positive societal impact.

Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives that question the status quo and spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting, technology and design, and corporate and digital ventures. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, fueled by the goal of helping our clients thrive and enabling them to make the world a better place.

Practice Area Profile

BCG GAMMA combines innovative skills in computer science, artificial intelligence, statistics, and machine learning with deep industry expertise. The BCG GAMMA team is comprised of world-class data scientists and business consultants who specialize in the use of advanced analytics to get breakthrough business results. Our teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, building fact-bases, designing innovative algorithms, creating scale through designing tools and apps, and training colleagues and clients in new solutions.

Here at BCG GAMMA, you’ll have the chance to work with clients in every BCG region and every industry area. We are also a core member of a rapidly growing analytics enterprise at BCG – a constellation of teams focused on driving practical results for BCG clients by applying leading edge analytics approaches, data, and technology.

What You'll Do

We’re looking for a passionate and talented Data Scientist to join our rapidly growing team. In this role, you’ll have the chance to roll up your sleeves and apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of industries. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action and exceptional communicators.

WHO YOU ARE:
Are comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Can distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Are able to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Have significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data; as well as a deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and are able to translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills

What You'll Bring (Experience & Qualifications)

Recent PhD or Master’s Degree in computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, machine learning, or other data centric disciplines with 2-5 years of relevant industry work experience providing advanced analytics solutions strongly preferred.
Strong record of extracurricular activity, professional accomplishment, and leadership
Additional experience in core analytic methods such as predictive modeling, customer segmentation/clustering, network analysis, supply chain optimization, etc.
Fluency in at least one scripting language (e.g. Python, R)
Fluency in English and local office language is required

ERM is seeking motivated Senior Consultant to join our Social Performance team in Perth. You will be part of a dynamic technical team responsible for consulting on Social Performance and Sustainability matters, while networking with ERM's global Social Performance Technical Community to share best practices across the industry.
This is an opportunity for an experienced Social Performance professional to advance their career to the next level with a global leader in sustainability, and to make a significant impact in successfully implementing ERM's global strategy.
Ideal candidates will bring prior consulting experience in the oil and gas, mining, and/or power (renewables) sector, in order to provide technical understanding, strategic direction, and strong project management. An interest in applying existing knowledge and expertise to solve complex challenges is critical.
Responsibilities:
Provide oversight and quality control for data collection, management, reduction and analysis.
Collaborate with other ERM national and global practitioners via working in teams composed of multi-disciplinary professionals from multiple offices around the global ERM organisation.
Liaise with various stakeholders, including State/Local Governments and community groups.
Mentor junior-level consulting staff to develop their skill sets including technical skills, project experience, and general consulting and decision-making skills.
Contribute to proposal development, including development of technical scopes and cost estimates in accordance with ERM’s policies and processes.
When required, direct and monitor project management activities related to projects, including task delegation and direction, subcontractor management, health & safety protocol management, monitoring of commercial performance, quality review of deliverables, and interaction with clients.
Work with other global ERM resources to deepen relationships with ERM key clients to expand ERM’s profile and market share in the global market (through a combination of excellence in technical delivery and business development support).
Requirements:
A recognised Bachelor degree in social science or related discipline; professional registration would be an asset.
5+ years demonstrable Consulting experience.
Experience working as part of an integrated team to develop social impact assessments, human rights impact assessment, labour audits, or other related scopes of work.
Project management skills (e.g., development of work plans, budgets, schedules, and project controls).
Excellent writing, communication, strategic thinking, and attention to detail.
Relationship building skills with colleagues and clients, i.e., “people” skills.
Who We Are:
As the world’s leading sustainability consulting firm, ERM is uniquely positioned to contribute to the environment and society through the expertise and energy of our employees worldwide. Sustainability is what we do, and is at the heart of both our service offerings and how we operate our business. For our people, our vision means attracting, inspiring, developing and rewarding our people to work with the best clients and on the biggest challenges, thus creating valuable careers. We achieve our vision in a sustainable manner by maintaining and living our ERM values that include Accountability, Caring for our People, Client Focus, Collaboration, Empowerment, and Transparency.
ERM does not accept recruiting agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, ERM employees or any other company location. ERM is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
ERM is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status or disability status.
Thank you for your interest in ERM.

Hexagon is a global leader in sensor, software and autonomous solutions and has more than 20,000 employees across 50 countries and net sales of approximately 4.3bn USD. Hexagon’s Mining division is enabling an autonomous future through the delivery of an autonomous connected ecosystem in mines across the globe. We bring survey, geology, mine planning & design, fleet management, production optimization, collision avoidance and operator safety together in a life-of-mine solution that integrates people and processes. Our customers are safer and more productive through insight-driven decisions that sustainably captures more value from mining operations.
Enterprise Suite of Products
Hexagon’s Enterprise portfolio is a data analytics hub that nurtures collaboration. It helps mines access, see downstream effects, and make decisions from operational technology data. It provides data visualization, accessibility, data analytics and reporting by connecting and structuring data from Planning, Operations, Safety and Drill & Blast systems.
The Role
The Mine Enterprise portfolio is currently seeking an experienced Application Engineer to join their Perth based team on a permanent full-time basis. If you answer yes to the following questions, this might be the role for you:
Are passionate about data and unlocking its hidden value?
Are you driven by successful customer adoption of technology to improve processes that generate a tangible return on investment?
Have you had experience in creating business intelligence reporting that can be standardized across multiple customers?
Desired Skills
Major Areas of Responsibility
Within the position of Application Engineer, you would be the global champion for the suite of Mine Enterprise products to drive successful customer adoption and obtain customer return-on-investment. You are the voice of the customer and internal support teams and you will provide clear feedback to the software development team to better the solution for all customers. This position is responsible for driving customer adoption for the suite of solutions that deliver on a vision to connect data across the life-of-mine value chain.
Skills and Experience Required
We are looking for an individual with the following skills and experience:
Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering / Software Engineering, or related fields
Proven experience within a similar position (software solution consulting)
Good time management and ability to work with disparate teams
Prior experience with technology in the mining industry (planning, operations, drill & blast, safety). Global experience desirable
Experience with Microsoft Power BI, Tableau and Microsoft SQL Server or Postgres
Experience in the testing and validation of technology products and the development of training courses to assist internal lead experts.
As an individual who can consolidate findings of software usage in-the-field across different customers, it is essential that you have the technical aptitude to interpret and respond to customer requirements, in addition to the soft skills to explain the benefits to management and sales teams.
Customer Success
Provide technical sales assistance to regional teams including trials and demos
Provide guidance on best practice use of Hexagon Mining products
Primarily provide 2nd tier support to escalated requests from the regional service & support teams
Attend customer sites and regional offices for technical knowledge transfer
Assist with building key reference sites for our BI system in each region
Provide global guidance for all major commercial deals including RFI and RFP’s.
What’s on Offer
Apart from a salary package that is commensurate with your skills and experience, you will also benefit from the following:
Personalized training and upskilling opportunities for career development for both technical and soft skills
Work with a diverse, talented, multi-disciplinary team across the globe, gaining valuable skills and knowledge servicing some of the biggest names in the industry
International and domestic travel to a variety of locations for client services
Modern, well-appointed office space with a casual and friendly atmosphere
Work life balance support
Social events, team building activities, morning teas, quiz nights and more.
Travel
This position involves travel intrastate, interstate and overseas to support and deploy Hexagon Mining’s product in the field.
Language
Fluent English (written and verbal) is a pre-requisite.
Spanish or Portuguese or other second language would be very favorable.
Job Family
Information Technology
City
Perth

We are seeking an enthusiastic System/Data Specialist to join our team. The successful applicant will be working to help with new builds and servicing existing clients. You will have opportunity to deal with variety of client from small/medium business to multinational company. The candidates need to have capability to quickly absorb new knowledge, can do attitude and willingness to do self-study/self-research when required. Candidates need to have excellent interpersonal and communication skills as well as excellent written and spoken English skills.
A successful candidate will need to have the following:
Advanced knowledge of SQL and understanding of system data flows
Have a strong data analysis experience with Tableau or Power BI
Minimum 3 years commercial experience or as a Data Specialist will be desired
Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics or similar field is desirable
Ability to read, interpret and verify data from multiple sources/formats
Ability to translate analysis outcomes into commercial solutions
Experience and knowledge in data warehouse and big data will be a good plus
Capability to manage their own work, and deliver the agreed deliverable on time
In addition to these core skills, you will need to have:
Capability to work on client sites when required
Capability in reading and writing technical document
Conduct testing according to plan
Options for full time/part-time is available for suitable candidates. Remuneration is based on the skills set and experience of the candidate. If you are looking for a position that will offer you potential to grow and develop your career then please contact us.
Please note - only candidates who we believe are suited for the role will be contacted. You must have permission to work in Australia and resides in Perth area.

We are seeking an enthusiastic System/Data Specialist to join our team. The successful applicant will be working to help with new builds and servicing existing clients. You will have opportunity to deal with variety of client from small/medium business to multinational company. The candidates need to have capability to quickly absorb new knowledge, can do attitude and willingness to do self-study/self-research when required. Candidates need to have excellent interpersonal and communication skills as well as excellent written and spoken English skills.
A successful candidate will need to have the following:
Advanced knowledge of SQL and understanding of system data flows
Have a strong data analysis experience with Tableau or Power BI
Minimum 3 years commercial experience or as a Data Specialist will be desired
Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics or similar field is desirable
Ability to read, interpret and verify data from multiple sources/formats
Ability to translate analysis outcomes into commercial solutions
Experience and knowledge in data warehouse and big data will be a good plus
Capability to manage their own work, and deliver the agreed deliverable on time
In addition to these core skills, you will need to have:
Capability to work on client sites when required
Capability in reading and writing technical document
Conduct testing according to plan
Options for full time/part-time is available for suitable candidates. Remuneration is based on the skills set and experience of the candidate. If you are looking for a position that will offer you potential to grow and develop your career then please contact us.
Please note - only candidates who we believe are suited for the role will be contacted. You must have permission to work in Australia and resides in Perth area.

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

We believe that equality drives innovation. Our commitment to accelerating equality starts at the top with our board and CEO and extends across every part of the company. We currently have a position available working with our client Main Roads WA based in Bunbury on a 12-month fixed term contract.
This position will see you involved in the following activities:
Assist in the programing, planning and development of the annual maintenance works program with respect to the Routine, Periodic and Specific Maintenance programs including budget allocations
Issue Works Orders and monitor/audit contractor’s performance and progress of delivery of Works Orders
Update plans and programs and report on progress & outcomes
Review and recommend claims for payment
Monitor expenditure against budget and report on progress
Review and Audit data to ensure it is accurate and up to date
Provide specialist technical support and advice on delivery of Maintenance Works to contractor

What you will bring to the team
8 years + experience in a similar role
Experience in road construction and maintenance processes and practices
Understanding of environmental requirements in relation to Main Roads network maintenance and environmental management
A background in horticulture, vegetation management or environmental sciences
Experience in operating maintenance management systems, databases, spreadsheets and financial management
Reading and interpreting technical drawings, specifications and contract requirements
Building and enhancing stakeholder relationships
A high level of written communication including contract correspondence, preparation of technical reports and recommendations
Certification of Basic Worksite Traffic Management
We offer a competitive salary and paid overtime in addition to an employee wellness program and income protection insurance.
Asset Management Support Services
GHD has been appointed by Main Roads Western Australia to deliver a state-wide Operational Asset Management Support Service (AMSS) contract. Under this contract, GHD provide regional support to assist Main Roads manage and maintain the State road network

Why GHD?
Being the best we can be is in our culture.
We are a family of smart, innovative and creative problem solvers. In our employee-owned company, everything feels like it matters more. Challenge us and help us come up with new solutions to ensure water, energy and urbanisation are made sustainable for generations to come.
Our commitment to you
Commitment is a powerful word that defines how we do business, how we serve our clients and how we care for one another. We will support your needs by giving you the tools to do your best work and then recognise achievements. We will set your curiosity free to allow brilliant minds to do their best work. We will invest in new ideas, removing barriers where we can. Finally, we will encourage you to collaborate with thousands of diverse people across our global business.
Who we are
We are committed to solving the world's biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanisation . GHD is a global professional services company that is a leader in engineering, construction and architectural expertise. Established in 1928, we remain wholly owned by our people. We are 10,000+ diverse and skilled individuals, yet we are proudly ‘One GHD’ across more than 200 offices, spanning five continents – Asia, Australia, Europe, North and South America, and the Pacific region. Delivering extraordinary social and economic outcomes, we are passionate about building lasting relationships with our partners and clients.

The team:
At GHD Digital, our Advanced Analytics and Data Science Team work collaboratively to streamline our clients approach to data, by delivering a suite of services including:
Data strategy, governance and architecture
Business Intelligence
Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) solutions
Data products and platforms
Data Advisory services
Responsibilities include:
Leading and mentoring a team of AA&DS consultants in Western Australia
Actively engage with clients and the market to identify insights and opportunities to shape AA&DS and business development.
Inform, develop and be proactive in industry leading AA&DS solutions based upon insights and client requirements.
Working proactively with AA&AI Regional Lead, DI Practice Director, Market Development Leads to align talent management within the AA&DS Team to GHD Digital’s business goals.
Actively drive growth of AA&DS capabilities and revenue channels.
Contribute to development of the business plan and drive for achievement and surpassing agreed targets within it.
Influence and proactively engage GHD industry professionals across Water, Energy & Resources, Environment and Transportation to understand client challenges
Use a range of techniques such as design thinking, information architecture, data modelling to rapidly architect and prototype solutions
Lead the technical design and development of client solutions incorporating Big Data, geospatial, predictive analytics, ML and AI technologies
Research, experiment, create and package solutions that GHD can take to the market to drive business growth
What you will bring to the team:
8 years’ plus experience within digital, analytics and consulting disciplines in a similar role
Experience with asset related industries such as Water, Energy and Transportation is highly desirable
Confidence in communicating with senior client leadership and presenting complex solutions in a simple way
Ability to facilitate client discovery workshops, lead the discussion, capture requirements and formulate solutions
Experience in using products such as PowerBI, Alteryx and open source visualisation tools
Fluency in several programming languages such as Python, R, Scala, or Java with the ability to pick up new languages and technologies quickly
Demonstrated experience working with Cloud Platforms (AWS, Azure) and technologies (DataBricks, MapReduce, Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Impala)
In return the right candidate will be work in an innovative, creative, relaxed environment, with access to training, software, environments & coaching to help develop yourself.

Kinetic Logging Services Pty Ltd is a division of EPIROC and is a leading supplier of Geophysical Services in Australia, with offices in Perth, Newman and Brisbane.
RTOC (Realtime Operations Centre)
Our business involves Geophysical Logging measurements made with various downhole tools conveyed by logging trucks which operate both night and day shifts. There are site-based supervisors for the teams.
1 x Permanent Full time positions
1 x Permanent Part time position - 3 days/nights per week
About the Role:
Based at Kewdale, Western Australia and reporting to the RTOC Coordinator, the successful candidates will be providing operational and technical support for our Unique OreSight service, as well as monitoring data flow and optimising productivity. The position would suit a person with previous experience in mining related asset and reliability role wanting a Perth based position with a similar roster.
RTOC operates on a 24 hr, 7 day a week, 365 days a year and is staffed on a roster system.
Perth based, 12 hour shifts - 7 days, 7 nights and 7 days R&R (subject to change)
Be available to work days, nights, holidays, and weekends on a rolling roster as the business requires
Some travel to site may be required, but the role is primarily based in our Kewdale headquarters
The RTOC operation supports the field operations from our Perth office and performs the following functions:
Call centre for support for the field operators – troubleshooting &technical assistance
Maintain and provide accurate log entries of faults with resolutions
Perform technical troubleshooting base on fault logs
Provide 1st/2nd level of technical support where necessary
Monitor OreSight Vehicle data Flow (Power BI, MIX, Telematic etc)
Troubleshoot Trimble Communication issues
Convert coordinate files to enable Trimble operation
Quality control OreSight log data
Maintain and update troubleshooting procedures for operational support and improved performance of the OreSight fleet.
Assist as required with writing incident reports.
Identify areas of potential improvement & development to increase productivity and reliability
Contribute to documentation as required
The logging units are custom built in-house, and the RTOC team has access to, and the support of, appropriate experts to build the specific skills and knowledge relative to the equipment they need to support.
About you:
Engineering, computer systems or science diploma from TAFE or University (preferred but not essential)
1-2 Years of experienced with troubleshooting (an advantage);
Exposure to Electrical/Electronic/Instrumentation fault finding remotely (preferred but not essential);
Exposure to PLC/Instrumentation automation (preferred but not essential);
Exposure to Wire Line logging unit (preferred but not essential);
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
Good time management and communication skills;
Ability to manage multiple problems at once and prioritise issues;
Active listening and effective communication
Positive Can do attitude.
Proficient in Microsoft Office
Clear communication in written and spoken English
Applicants must be able to:
Pass a Pre-employment Medical.
Pass On-going pre-employment and random Drug & Alcohol screening;
Have the Right to Work and Live in Australia
Provide 2 professional references
Please provide a Cover Letter outlining your relevant and suitable skills and experience for this role.
As per the Western Australian Government's mandatory vaccination directive for Resource Sector Workers, we have extended the Government mandate and our full workforce will be required to be triple vaccinated against COVID -19.
Therefore, this will be a requirement of employment with us.
About Epiroc:
Epiroc is a leading productivity partner for the mining, infrastructure and natural resources industries. With cutting-edge technology, Epiroc develops and produces innovative drill rigs, rock excavation and construction equipment, and provides world-class service and consumables. The company was founded in Stockholm, Sweden, and has over 13,000 passionate people worldwide supporting and collaborating with customers in more than 150 countries.

At NTT we believe that by using innovative technology we can solve global challenges and create a world that is sustainable and secure. We are looking for curious people, from diverse backgrounds, that are keen to work in a fast-paced and agile environment.

At NTT we trust our employees to do the right thing, even when no one is watching, which is why we offer flexibility in the workplace. The majority of our roles are hybrid, meaning we encourage a balance of working from home and our local office. Ask our recruitment team if this is a hybrid role.
Want to be a part of our team?
Responsible for setup and installation of technical systems, applications, or process designs for client’s purchased or outsourced technology and business process solutions. Works directly with client to manage initial access, map and transfer data, create process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users. Tests and troubleshoots functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to product and professional services teams for product and process improvements. May work directly with clients on-site or provide installation support remotely.

The Deflector Processing Plant produces both Gold bullion and Copper concentrate through gravity separation, flotation and a newly commissioned CIP circuit. The process plant receives ore from the Deflector and Deflector South West mines located on site, as well as trucked ore from Silver Lake’s Rothsay mine. This copper/gold processing facility presents a unique opportunity to test and refine the metallurgical process of a new plant, within an established and high-performing environment.
THE ROLE
This is an exciting opportunity for a new Metallurgy Graduate to become part of the Deflector team and help us build on the enviable success we have had to date. Working collaboratively, and learning from a team of experienced Metallurgists, you will provide support to the operations team to enable the safe, efficient, sustainable and cost-effective extraction of ore.
Key responsibilities of this role will include:
Monitor the day-to-day technical results of the processing plant and assist Metallurgists to optimise recovery
Provide input into operating variable adjustments needed to achieve target outputs
Report any performance issues in a timely manner
Effectively communicate plant performance feedback and changes to the plan to the operators as needed
Learn to operate sections of the processing plant, including crushing, grinding, flotation, dewatering and CIP
Assist in production and shipment forecasting and budgeting to develop your metallurgical accounting skills
Look for and suggest improvement opportunities in all areas of the plant and data recording
Foster a strong and productive culture though communication, dedication and teamwork.
ABOUT YOU
You are a talented individual with excellent interpersonal skills and an enthusiasm to learn. You have a passion for Metallurgy and are looking for a supportive and cooperative team where your skills will be nurtured to flourish.
You can demonstrate
Recent completion of a Bachelor of Science in Extractive Metallurgy or Chemical Engineering
Basic understanding of metallurgical processes and testing procedures
Strong MS Office skills, with solid experience in using excel
A positive attitude, curiosity to learn and ability to work well with a wide range of people
Commitment to safe work practices and conscientious completion of safety documentation
WA "C" class driver's license.
This role is offered on an 8:6 FIFO roster from Perth and will allow you to become an important part of our growth and success. You will work with an exceptional group of operators and Metallurgists in the Processing team and be mentored to develop your skills.
We promote a culture of mutual respect and equal opportunity. Our employment programs are underpinned by our commitment to diversity and equality and, as such, we welcome applications from women and people from culturally diverse backgrounds.
To apply, please forward your CV and covering letter by following the APPLY prompts no later than Friday 12th August. You must hold full work rights for Australia to be considered for this role.
Please note - candidates will not be accepted or considered from third parties or recruitment consultancies.
Job Type: Full-time

12 months Max term role
Bankwest is built around our branches and the colleagues who help our customers achieve their financial ambitions every single day. Our Specialists are the face of our branches and we pride ourselves on that.
You’ll never feel like just a number here, we have multiple ways to recognise our colleagues. We’re real people who work hard and have a laugh along the way. Our culture is made by us, and we couldn’t be the bank we are today without our people.
Do work that matters:
The Chief Customer Office (CCO) is responsible for delivering customer experiences to create value for our customers, colleagues and the community. CCO is made up of the following team; Data & Analytics, Brand & Marketing, Sponsorship, Digital, Change & Communications, External Communications and Loyalty.
See yourself in our team:
Your team is the Data & Analytics Team and is responsible for Data Management, Data Science, Customer Communications and Decision Support. The Decision Support team are focused on deepening our customer relationships through data analytics, using internal data, analytics and optimisation for use in in targeting relevant communications to customers. The team is also responsible for supporting remediation projects to ensure customers are refunded timely and as accurately as possible.
Responsibilities:
Gain a good understanding of business challenges faced by Remediation Tribe and intended customer outcomes to ensure that the right analytics approach can be taken
Deep dive into data and perform analysis that can be articulated through data outputs and visualisations
Ensure stakeholders are kept informed and updated regarding relevant analytics work and delivery - Ensure technical concepts are translated into non-technical concepts for stakeholders where relevant
Optimise data model for remediation and decision support initiatives.
Input into remediation strategies to ensure streamlined processes within risk appetite.
Lead continuous improvement initiatives to support the automation and operational excellence within the team - Demonstrate the Bankwest vision and values supporting an agile team culture that drives employee engagement whilst achieving personal and business outcomes.
Partner effectively with colleagues across the bank, to deliver excellent outcomes for our customers.
Adhere to the Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct sets the standards of behaviour, actions and decisions we expect from our people.
Qualifications & Experience
Significant experience in Remediation Analytics
Risk Mindset – proactively identify and understand, openly discuss and act on current and future risks.
Expert in data extraction, manipulation and visualisation
Ability to handle large and complex data sets using different applications as appropriate.
Expert in SQL or SAS or comparable product suites
Strong verbal and written presentation skills and the ability to present technical concepts to a non-technical audience
Strong problem-solving skills and independent thinker
Good organisation and multi-tasking skills to take on multiple remediation projects at any one time
Working with us:
Whether you’re passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career with Bankwest is for you.
Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive, and flexible workplace with flexible work locations. One where we’re driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.
Here, you’ll thrive. You’ll be supported when faced with challenges and empowered to tackle new opportunities. You’ll be empowered to do your best work and be given the choice on when and where that work happens. We really love working here, and we think you will too.
The health and safety of our people, customers and communities is our number one priority. This means that we require all of our employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please speak to us if you have any queries about this based on your individual circumstances.

About us
Rocketmine is a division of the ASX-listed Delta Drone International Group – a growing global Drones-as-a-Service Provider, with operations in the mining, energy, construction and agricultural sectors.
About the Role
Rocketmine is currently seeking UAV Pilots for its operations in the Western Australian mining industry.
This is a fantastic opportunity for keen aviation professionals to expand their skills into mining and spatial sciences.
We are offering permanent, full-time roles that involve daily drone operations and processing of aerial data to provide our customers with accurate and up-to-date spatial information.
Our drone operations involve long-range, fixed-wing operations for mapping (including beyond-visual-line-of-sight), multi-rotor operations for inspections and 3D modelling, and a range of sensors including RGB & thermal cameras and LiDAR.
You will be based on one of our customers’ mine sites, working as part of their technical services team on an 8 days on / 6 days off fly-in-fly-out roster from Perth.
For this role we are seeking pilots from a commercial aviation background (preferably with a pass in IREX) who are keen to apply their existing skills and experience to UAV operations in the mining industry, while also learning valuable new skills in aerial surveying, photogrammetry, and the geospatial sciences.
Rocketmine will provide all necessary training to prepare successful candidates for the role prior to deployment to site.
Key Duties include
Planning & safe execution of all drone flights, including long-range beyond-visual-line-of-sight (BVLOS) operations.
Basic care, servicing and maintenance of drones and other associated equipment.
Maintain accurate flight and maintenance documentation.
Timely processing of aerial data, including quality/accuracy checks and delivery to the end users.
Regular liaison with mine site personnel for determining the aerial survey requirements and scheduling.
Skills and Experience
Private or Commercial Pilots Licence
IREX pass (or ability to obtain)
Ability to pass regular medical and drug/alcohol screens
Australian C Class Drivers’ Licence
Benefits of the role
Become part an innovative and growing international company

At NTT we believe that by using innovative technology we can solve global challenges and create a world that is sustainable and secure. We are looking for curious people, from diverse backgrounds, that are keen to work in a fast-paced and agile environment.

At NTT we trust our employees to do the right thing, even when no one is watching, which is why we offer flexibility in the workplace. The majority of our roles are hybrid, meaning we encourage a balance of working from home and our local office. Ask our recruitment team if this is a hybrid role.
Want to be a part of our team?
The primary responsibility of the TS Implementation Engineer (L2) is to deliver to client solution requirements, and actively develop skills that enable NTT’s vision to use technology and innovation to deliver a secure and connect future. They perform configurations, action installations and attend to break/fix events, but importantly are also actively encouraged to provide an opinion, and bring new ideas to our team and customers.

"Responsible for setup and installation of security solutions, applications, services or process designs for client’s purchased or outsourced security technology and security process solutions. Works directly with client to deploy and manage initial access, analyse security data, create integrations and automations as well as process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users. Tests and troubleshoots functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to product and professional services teams for product and process improvements. May work directly with clients on-site or provide installation support remotely."
Working at NTT
Key Roles and Responsibilities:
Embrace training and learning, provide input to challenge our thinking on use of technology.
Own larger portions of an installation, break/fix incidents at a low to medium level of complexity.
Take responsibility for problem resolution and troubleshooting.
Respond to escalated client requests and support client applications to a first line resolution.
Escalate complex problems by working directly with relevant vendors and other third parties.
Assist with the documentation of security operating procedures relating to installations and fixes.
Conduct elementary presentations within the customer's organization.
May be required to occasionally perform project work outside hours.
Expected to take ownership of relevant technologies according to domain or specialization.
Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:
Basic understanding and appreciation of technical design and business principles
Demonstrates fundamental project management and administration ability
Display customer engagement skills
Demonstrate relevant domain specialist knowledge
Good verbal communication skills
Client focused and display a proactive approach to solving problems
Ability to work under pressure
Academic Qualifications and Certifications:
Computer Science / Information Technology Degree or equivalent together with specialised training in new technologies and legacy systems or equivalent
Required Experience:
Basic work experience in a technical engineering or similar role
Experience engaging with clients and conducting presentations
Basic project administration and documentation experience

Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.

About us
Rocketmine is a division of the ASX-listed Delta Drone International Group – a growing global Drones-as-a-Service Provider, with operations in the mining, energy, construction and agricultural sectors.
About the Role
Rocketmine is currently seeking UAV Pilots for its operations in the Western Australian mining industry.
This is a fantastic opportunity for keen aviation professionals to expand their skills into mining and spatial sciences.
We are offering permanent, full-time roles that involve daily drone operations and processing of aerial data to provide our customers with accurate and up-to-date spatial information.
Our drone operations involve long-range, fixed-wing operations for mapping (including beyond-visual-line-of-sight), multi-rotor operations for inspections and 3D modelling, and a range of sensors including RGB & thermal cameras and LiDAR.
You will be based on one of our customers’ mine sites, working as part of their technical services team on an 8 days on / 6 days off fly-in-fly-out roster from Perth.
For this role we are seeking pilots from a commercial aviation background (preferably with a pass in IREX) who are keen to apply their existing skills and experience to UAV operations in the mining industry, while also learning valuable new skills in aerial surveying, photogrammetry, and the geospatial sciences.
Rocketmine will provide all necessary training to prepare successful candidates for the role prior to deployment to site.
Key Duties include
Planning & safe execution of all drone flights, including long-range beyond-visual-line-of-sight (BVLOS) operations.
Basic care, servicing and maintenance of drones and other associated equipment.
Maintain accurate flight and maintenance documentation.
Timely processing of aerial data, including quality/accuracy checks and delivery to the end users.
Regular liaison with mine site personnel for determining the aerial survey requirements and scheduling.
Skills and Experience
Private or Commercial Pilots Licence
IREX pass (or ability to obtain)
Ability to pass regular medical and drug/alcohol screens
Australian C Class Drivers’ Licence
Benefits of the role
Become part an innovative and growing international company
Work with a dynamic team of professionals (pilots, surveyors, engineers) who can support you in your role.
Establish yourself in a growing and fast-developing technical field in the mining industry
Gain valuable knowledge and experience in spatial sciences, with the opportunity to gain formal qualifications in this field.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $70,000.00 – $90,000.00 per year
Schedule:
12 hour shift

Research and Development/Food Technology Role
Integral role in the 'Pot to Plate' lobster supply-chain
Permanent Full Time Position
The Role:
As a key member of our Export Operations team, you will be responsible for leading the research, monitoring and continual improvement of our core food processing technologies.
The primary objective of the role is to improve, refine and ensure accuracy of our food production systems, processes and quality controls.
Working alongside the production team you will achieve this objective by conducting research experiments, production trials and quality monitoring within our food manufacturing facilities. You will apply scientific and engineering principles in undertaking research, managing associated data and presenting your findings.
Safety is our number one value. You will manage in-house activities and contractors within a world-class safety management system.
Duties include:
Product development validation testing.
Maintaining a suite of accurate and documented production settings and product specifications.
Collaborating with our sales and marketing team to develop new products that match targeted consumer preferences.
Assist production crews and management in problem solving on processes while preserving food safety and quality.
Developing, and tracking progress to, annual research budgets.
Helping the business achieve safety, financial, and operational KPI’s.
Skills and Experience:
Tertiary qualifications in scientific or related discipline.
Strong reporting and MS Office skills, particularly MS Excel.
Contemporary data management and analytical techniques.
3+ years of hands-on experience in research, new product/process development or quality control – ideally in the food manufacturing industry.
Self-starter who is naturally curious and enjoys working in a fast-paced environment.
Proficiency in food equipment/process engineering.
Be familiar with Australian food legislation, regulations, and standards such as SQF, HACCP and GMP.
If you have a keen interest in any of the below areas, and meet the above criteria we would love to hear from you.
Research and Development
Food Technology and Safety
Science and Technology
Quality Assurance and Control
We are a large business with a great team and a small business feel. This an opportunity to work in a fact-based organisation. We value hard work, a desire to continuously improve, and the ability to work with people from all walks of life. The successful applicant must be able to pass a National Police Clearance Check. Based in Welshpool or Fremantle, this position will require some out-of-hours work and occasional travel within WA.
Interested applicants are encouraged to apply. For further information please contact Paul Ridout - GM Export Operations on 9435 8910
To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below.

Do you have your head in the Cloud?
Combine the best of your ingenuity and Cloud technologies to build a better world and lead clients towards change.
Join us and do extraordinary things.
About you:
As a Data Migration Engineer / Lead, you will design and maintain data analytic road maps and data structures that support business and technology objectives. Naturally inquisitive and open to exploration of underlying data, finding valuable insights and work with functional areas to drive identified actions, you enjoy working both autonomously and as part of a team and have the confidence to influence and communicate with stakeholders at all levels and comfortable working with ambiguity in complex environments.
Our team:
Accenture’s Modern Data Platforms practice covers the range of Data and AI skills across all domains of data governance & quality, cloud & traditional data engineering and visual insights & next generation user interfaces. When combined with Accenture’s broader Strategy and Consulting and Technology businesses, we are able to bring together the unique end to end business changes through the application of Data and AI. You will join our migration capability in the Modern Data Platforms team
About the role:
You will become an integral part of our Cloud First & Applied Intelligence team with the credibility, expertise and insight clients depend on working alongside our industry, functional and technology SMEs with famous brands and household names to tackle some of the most challenging problems in industry and the community.
In our team you will:
Work as a hands-on, authentic and committed Data Engineer to support clients across a range of industries.
Take responsibility for all aspects of data engineering from delivery planning, estimating and analysis, through to data architecture and pipeline design, delivery, and production implementation
Design and implement complex data solutions ranging from batch to streaming and event-driven architectures, across cloud, on-premises and hybrid client technology landscapes
Provide technical thought leadership to define data migration strategy and solution design using ETL (Extract-Transform-Load) methodology
Carry out root cause analysis of the problem and propose solutions.
Ensure technical expectations of deliverables are met
Drive engineering and architectural practices and standards
Develop end to end analytical solutions which will require transformation of complex data sets from multiple source systems, fix bugs, develop enhancements, address queries and requests from business and assist in data and integration tests.
We are looking for experience in the following:
Using tools and techniques such as Data Lake, SQL, Python/Pyspark (or other programming languages with the capability to learn Python), Git, AWS, ADO DevOps.
Data migration project experience
Strong hands-on experience in building data engineering pipelines.
Worked on delivering Data & Analytics solution on cloud platform, preferably AWS
Used cloud data services, such as S3, RedShift, Glue, Step Functions, Lambda
Desirable
Previous experience with high-scale or distributed RDBMS (Teradata, Netezza, Greenplum, Aster Data, Vertica), including metadata management, SQL development and performance tuning within these database environments.
Experience in addressing and implementing data quality solutions, data reconciliation framework and strong understanding and experience in building data lineage documentation, and Data Catalogues.
Experience with related/complementary open source software platforms and languages (e.g. Java, Linux, Apache, Perl/PHP, Chef)

Job Title: Early Career Hydrogeologists - Field work and Numerical Modelling
Job Descriptions:
Great balance of field work and desk-based studies
Niche specialist company with a close-knit team
Long term role with a rewarding career pathway in environmental management

About AGE Consultants
We’re Australia’s groundwater specialists, providing groundwater and environmental advisory for more than 20 years. We have a depth of knowledge and experience across major industries, agriculture, government, and communities throughout Australasia and beyond. We listen to our clients’ needs and challenges, share our knowledge and tailor our service delivery accordingly.
We’re hydrogeologists, hydrogeochemists, and numerical modellers. We specialise in end-to-end groundwater services, from field work and modelling to analysis and reports, to expert advisory and peer review. This gives us an acute understanding of the commercial, environmental, government and community challenges faced in our increasingly complex world.
As early adopters of cutting-edge modelling techniques, we’re dedicated to delivering informed, comprehensive outcomes for our clients, no matter the sector or challenge. We provide scientifically rigorous advice and high-quality outputs to support development and progress projects.
Through powerful insights and clear advice, we empower informed water decisions that help our clients, communities and environment thrive.

The Role
Working in the Australian mining and water sector, as a Hydrogeologist in our Perth office, you will collect, manage, and report on groundwater data. Your key objectives will include:
drilling supervision and geological logging;
monitoring bore and VWP installations;
conducting field tests (slug tests, packer tests, and pumping tests);
routine collection of water samples;
bore design and technical specifications;
data analysis and interpretation;
provide input and planning of projects including field programs
reporting ; and
learning our bespoke numerical modelling techniques
This is a full-time role with a good work life balance and a long-term development pathway, advancing your career as a groundwater consultant. At AGE you will be encouraged to explore various career path options such as project management, conceptualisation, numerical modelling, and business development.
You
You will be seeking to join an integrative specialist groundwater team as you build your knowledge and develop a career in groundwater with us, embarking on a challenging mix of field work and desktop studies. A successful applicant will have the following:
a degree in earth science, geoscience, environmental science or geology. Post graduate studies in hydrogeology would be an advantage;
an appreciation of the importance of accurate data collection;
a balance of field and desktop capabilities, with an interest in modelling being an advantage;
strong verbal and written communication and sound report writing skills; and
a valid manual drivers’ licence, preferably with 4WD experience and certification.
Preferably you would also have experience in:
drilling supervision, bore installations, and groundwater sampling; and
VWP installations, pumping tests, and packer testing (on-going training will be provided).
We are seeking a dynamic, enthusiastic, and practical self-starter to commit to cyclical field work routines throughout Western Australia as well as various locations around Australia on occasion.
You will be unafraid to roll your sleeves up, be physically fit, resilient, relate well to people from all walks of life, and enjoy a balance of desktop studies and being out in the field.
Graduates with an enthusiastic, committed approach, and relevant theoretical knowledge will also be considered.

Benefits of joining us
As part of the AGE team, you will be working on various projects that include groundwater impact assessments, water supply and security assessments, dewatering designs and optimisations, and groundwater management plans and strategies across various sectors.
We offer:
training tailored to an individual’s aspirations;
a very healthy pipeline of diverse groundwater work;
a competitive remuneration package;
a flexible work environment; and
the opportunity to collaborate with our diverse team of specialised groundwater consultants, many who have worked in the industry for more than 20 years.
We are open to early career hydrogeologists with qualifications and / or experience in other states in Australia, who are keen to relocate to Western Australia.
If you are keen to embark on a career in groundwater please submit your CV and a cover letter outlining your interest in this role via the relevant links. For more information please reach out to our Talent Consultant, Susan Leon on 0402 242 718
We thank recruitment agencies for their interest however, AGE Consultants and Susan Leon do not wish to be contacted regarding this campaign.

Field Data Analyst - Geoservices
Jandakot - Australia
Perm Role + super + Daily Bonus
Development and Career Progression
Family Focused Leave Policies

About us
Schlumberger is a technology company that partners with customers to access energy. Our people, representing over 160 nationalities, are providing leading digital solutions and deploying innovative technologies to enable performance and sustainability for the global energy industry. With expertise in more than 120 countries, we collaborate to create technology that unlocks access to energy for the benefit of all.
This role is working for our Geoservices team which is part of Schlumberger’s Well Construction division. Geoservices offers evaluation of hydrocarbon reservoirs and optimisation of field exploration, development, and production.
What you will be doing
You will be part of the Geoservices team, responsible for the delivery and quality of reports.
Supervise the collecting and processing of cuttings samples, from the planned lagged depths and intervals
Managing of and creating evaluation logs.
Analysis and interpretation of the drilled data
Communicating to the Client representatives any information regarding primary well control
Checking well integrity during well site operations as deduced from the data.
Monitor all the well parameters, maintaining Geoservices sensors to detect the well conditions and maintaining the gas detection equipment.
About you
Minimum BSc in Geology, Geological Applied Sciences, Earth Sciences or Applied Sciences
Unlimited Australian Work Rights - we are not offering sponsorship
Must have minimum 3 years field and offshore experience as a Field Data Analyst
Comprehensive knowledge of drilling equipment and techniques and drill string composition
Understand drilling fluids and hydraulics of the drilling fluids
Understand drilling parameters, their acquisition and treatment
Experience in the calibration and troubleshooting of sensors
Why work for us
We think this is a great place to work and here are just some of the benefits you could receive if you join us.
Additional day rate payment
Family focused leave policies
Employment Assistance Program
Development and career progression – pathway and training program

We are committed to providing employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

Eddyfi Technologies offre un portfolio diversifié d’appareils d’inspection non destructifs tels que des sondes, appareils et logiciels pour l’inspection de composantes critiques dans des industries-clés, notamment dans l’industrie pétrolière, aérospatiale et nucléaire. Par son esprit entrepreneurial, sa passion pour la science et la technologie, et en positionnant le client au cœur de nos préoccupations, Eddyfi Technologies œuvre dans plus de 110 pays et emploie plus de 600 personnes. Eddyfi Technologies comporte actuellement 13 centres d’excellence et bureaux de ventes partout autour du monde, tous composés exclusivement d’experts en contrôle non destructif.

As a regional Senior After-Sales Technician, you will be responsible for the calibration, testing, and repair of Eddyfi Technologies products, including management of customer cases (technical support) and return merchandize authorizations (RMA). It is a strategic position within a new company location, with opportunities to progress and support our customers in the Australasia region.

Responsibilities

Use electronic test equipment, diagnostic software, precision tools and measuring devices for equipment calibration.
Perform wiring, soldering, and assembly of specialized electronics and electromechanical components.
Analyze, diagnose, troubleshoot and repair customer-owned equipment.
Provide training to customers on the calibration and repair of Eddyfi Technologies products.
Manage the annual calibration of laboratory equipment to ensure traceability in accordance with NIST and internal Quality Assurance policies.
Maintain the proper working order and operation of laboratory equipment.
Maintain and organize calibration data and test documentation.
Assist with shipping and receiving of deliveries and support general office management.
Perform all work in accordance with internal safety policies and procedures.
Assist with management of customer cases and RMA’s, including tracking and responding to support inquiries.
Uphold close relationships with regional sales managers to support customers and participate in sales calls visits when required.
Manage office administration.
Required Experience

Minimum of 8 years in a similar role.
Associate degree electronics, computer repair
What we're looking for :
Certification and demonstrated skills in through hole and surface mount soldering and rework.
Ability to troubleshoot and repair sensitive electronics and electro-mechanical equipment.
Ability to multi-task, employ effective time management skills, and work independently with minimal supervision.
Ability to effectively communicate with customers regarding service orders, quotations & support cases.
Ability to work with technical sales specialist and sales managers.
Basic computer knowledge and proficiency using MS Word, Excel and Outlook.
Ability to work in a multicultural and decentralized organization.
Experience with NDT products and/or materials evaluation equipment a plus.
Familiarity with networking a plus.
Availability for occasional travel.
Applications will be accepted between June 16 and July 17 2022.
Avantages et bénéfices

Horaires de travail flexibles
Politique de vacances généreuse
Assurances collectives/REER avec participation de l’employeur
Passion et esprit d'équipe exceptionnels
Parmi les 300 plus grandes PME du Québec

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The opportunity
We are looking for a Consultant/Senior Consultant to join the Environment, Health and Safety (EHS) team based in Perth on either a full time basis. You will ideally have experience working in two or more of the following areas: process safety, safety in design, dangerous goods, risk management, and health and safety management systems.
You will work with our National EHS team to support our broad range of clients in WA and across Oceania to understand and address their EHS challenges and strategically help them to advance their EHS performance. You will work closely with our team leaders and clients to design and implement the right solution based on their specific needs using better practice methods.

Your key responsibilities
You will work as part of a leading and multidisciplinary team across a range of industries, assisting organisations to transform how they approach EHS. Your expertise will predominantly centre around technical EHS however you may also contribute to engagements involving EHS strategy, risk management, culture change, leadership, audit, analytical frameworks and tools to help clients succeed and navigate complex operating and regulatory environments.

Skills and attributes for success

To qualify for the role, you must have:
Minimum of three years demonstrated technical EHS experience in process safety, safety in design, dangerous goods, risk management, and health and safety management systems (will be highly regarded); either professional services/consulting industry or equivalent operational EHS experience.
Contemporary view of EHS with a strong grounding in risk management fundamentals, WHS legislation and management systems.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience working in a dynamic, fast paced environment.
The ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines.
Problem solving and analytical skills.
Proactive approach to take initiative and identify new opportunities.
Experience working well as part of a team.
Experience in developing and maintaining internal and external relationships including client management.
The ability to travel intra and interstate as required.

Ideally, you’ll also have:
Relevant tertiary qualifications in EHS, engineering, human factors, safety science, or business will be highly regarded.
Exemplar Global auditor and Cert IV in Training and Assessment qualifications are desirable but not necessary.

What we offer
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Continuous learning: personalised career development including coaching, experiences and formal learning so you’ll develop the mindset and skills you’ll need to thrive in the future.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

At EY, you’ll be rewarded and recognised based on your performance and our comprehensive benefits package can be tailored to your individual needs.

We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected, practices are equitable and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4).

The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third-party provider.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

to advance humanity – inspire curiosity
Curious to learn? Keen for a new challenge? Want to use your knowledge to make a difference? Then we are looking for you!
The Company
For over 22 years, Ozgene has been one of the leading companies for biotechnology and medical research in the world. Our vision is to advance humanity by inspiring curiosity, striving for constant innovation with the aim to provide our clients with the best service.
The Position
Ozgene is seeking a full-time Graduate Research Assistants to support scientific processes in our laboratory. Candidates should hold a Bachelor of Science majoring in molecular biology, genetics, biotechnology or an equivalent major. Teamwork as well as good written and oral communication skills are required for this role. As a member of our laboratory, you will work closely with a variety of staff members to promote a high standard of work in supporting scientific procedures.
Your Duties will Include
Understanding of general laboratory practice
Meeting laboratory safety requirements
Range of laboratory procedures
Data analysis
Undertaking sample preparation
Perform analytical testing and reporting
Ensure equipment and laboratory is kept clean and tidy
This role does not require any previous experience working in a laboratory.
Our Vision
Our vision is to expand Ozgene by building our team members from the ground up. We want curious people, that are not afraid of a challenge and want to use their knowledge to advance humanity. We will provide you with support and coaching in regards to our Organisational Excellence culture. Our philosophy focuses on using your skills to stabilise and improve our laboratory processes. Providing you with the conditions to channel your curiosity into exceptional service to our clients.
Please forward your resume, in confidence, to careers@ozgene.com.

Degree in Statistics/IT or equivalent technical studies/work experience or Master's degree in a quantitative field or related field with knowledge of data mining techniques
5-8 years of experience in Business Analytics
Data mining experience using Enterprise Miner
Forecasting experience using SAS ETS, SAS Forecast Studio
Familiar with data analysis, modeling, or decision science, including statistics, operations research, linear, multivariate or econometric modeling, forecasting, or time series
Certification in SAS STATS is added plus

Reporting Manager Title : Digital Delivery Lead
:
We’re not just engineers. We’re a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers and innovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals and resources get one step closer to solving our planet’s toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition. Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world.
Whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. And there’s no barrier to your potential career success. For more information, visit Worley.com.
We are looking for an experienced application / back-end developer with a good understanding of digital transformation/delivery projects.
You will be working amongst a team of engineers with diverse skills focused on digital delivery of projects including software products. You would be exposed to a range of industries such as mining, oil and gas, energy transition, net zero emission, renewable systems and more.
Your primary responsibility will be developing engineering software, automation tools, databases and data analytics.
The key responsibilities will include:
Accountability for the delivery of well-functioning digital projects.
Accountability for working with global teams located in different time zones
Being collaborative in a knowledge sharing environment
To be considered for this role it is envisaged you will possess the following skills & attributes:
A bachelor’s degree (as minimum) in Computer Science. Mechanical or Civil or dual degrees combined with computer science are also accepted.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in software development
Key requirements include:
C#, .NET, Visual studio
Python
React or Angular
Relational and non-relational database
Experience with cloud services (Azure preferred)
Experience in data governance and data quality frameworks
Excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate appropriately with corporate executives and technical teams.
Having experience in the following is advantageous:
ASP.net
Docker
Cloud deployment
Data science
Benefits to you
• Join a fun and inclusive, global team of professionals
The opportunity and support to develop your career globally;
A competitive remuneration package;
A global company commitment to all things related to health, safety and the environment
Advisian recognises the value of equal employment opportunity and is committed to promoting fairness, equity and diversity in its workplace hence we encourage applications from people with a variety of experience and backgrounds. In addition, we recognise that everyone’s personal circumstances differ and thus understand the importance of offering flexibility in the working arrangements of our personnel. On this basis we will consider all types of engagements models, including part time and job sharing. We also offer, the ability to purchase up to 8 weeks leave, compressed work weeks, flexible hours, working from home and accrued flex days, to ensure that we attract and retain a diverse and dynamic workforce.

You must have current unrestricted working rights for Australia to be eligible for consideration and only those candidates with appropriate qualifications and experience will be contacted directly.

Work type
PERMANENT - FULL TIME

Location
TELFER OPERATION

Applications close
11 AUG 2022

Explore the unknown
Our technical expertise is something we are quietly proud of. Through our investment in research and development, we have advanced the technical development of our mining methods, achieving operational efficiencies. Whether you are part of our offices, or at one of our sites near or far, you will find so much more than you expect.

Operations near and far
Located in the Great Sandy Desert in Western Australia, Telfer is a fly in fly out operation from Perth which recognises the importance of work-life balance. Our comfortable rooms include Foxtel, and our site offers quality food with healthy options, medical care, sports and recreation activities.

Who we’re looking for
We are seeking a resilient and motivated Environmental Advisor to provide support and advice related to environmental compliance and sustainability matters at Telfer.
Reporting to the Senior Environmental Advisor and joining a close-knit collaborative team, this challenging yet rewarding role will see you ensure environmental compliance by taking a direct advisory and interactive role with all work groups across site.
Other key deliverables of the role include:
Promoting and supporting the implementation of Newcrest's Environmental Standards, statutory conditions and Environmental Policy within the workplace
Reviewing, updating and maintaining the Telfer Environmental Management System (EMS)
Completing statutory reporting as required
Undertaking environmental inspections across site
Co-ordinating and managing contractors and their activities as required

To be successful in this role, you will be structured and well organised with exceptional time management skills. A sound knowledge of the statutory environmental requirements and the ability to provide competent advice on these requirements will be essential.
In addition, you will also possess:
Bachelor of Environmental Science or Engineering (Environmental) / or equivalent
Proven experience performing environmental inspections, incident management, data analysis and report writing with a background in Mining or Resources Industry highly preferred
Previous experience in Contractor Management
Exposure to Environmental Management Systems (EMS), ISO14001 or equivalent
Experience using ArcGIS
Knowledge of WA legislation

Please note: This is a permanent role on a FIFO roster, flying out of Perth.

Our commitment to you
Ownership is part of how we work. You will be part of a high-performance culture that is building our future. While structure and processes guide how we work, we continue to find opportunities to be nimble and provide support to develop, coach and mentor team members to continuously improve their knowledge and skills and relationship interactions.
Newcrest is also committed to building a diverse workforce. Our strategic focus is on enhancing diversity to reflect the communities in which we operate. Creating an inclusive culture will enable us to leverage the richness of cultures across our workforce and the capability of our diverse employees to get better business outcomes.

If you are seeking a new career challenge, where you can transfer your existing skills into a positive and empowering team environment, we’d love to hear from you!

At this stage, we are not accepting any external agency CVs for the opportunity.
